Otherwise, I'll worry about you.
Hehe,
I feel the same way when I'm around you.
I love spending time with you.
Nothing makes me happier than seeing you happy.
Ade and I spend an amiable session together.
The Commander's Room is so immaculate, it's practically sparkling.
I tidied up a bit before you arrived.
What do you think?
I like it. Thanks.
It doesn't even feel like my room anymore.
Hehe, I'm glad you like it.
You can always call on me whenever you need some cleaning done.
Oh no! I'm sorry.
Did I go a little overboard?
If you don't feel comfortable in here, I can change it back to the way it was.
No, I just meant that it's very clean.
Oh, haha! So that's what you meant.
Ade gives me some pointers on how to properly clean a room.
I prepared dessert for you, Master.
I hope you enjoy it.
Ade presents me with a three-tiered dessert tray filled with colorful and appetizing treats.
Isn't it hard whipping up so many different desserts?
It looks delicious. Thank you.
Not at all. Nothing is hard when I'm doing it for you.
Did I look like I was unhappy somehow?
If so, I apologize for giving off the wrong impression and making you worry.
Wait one moment, Master.
*Clatter*
Ade deftly takes out the dish at the very bottom.
You can start from level 1.
Let me know when you're done or if you want to switch to one of the other plates.
Thanks to Ade, I enjoy a sumptuous afternoon tea.
The wheel on the trolly that I use is broken.
I've sent it in for repairs, but it looks like I won't be able to use it today.
What a pain...
Indeed.
You must be worried for your faithful trolley.
It'll be fine.
I'll just have to work a little harder.
Sorry to bother you with my problems.
Ha,
I didn't expect you to be so thoughtful, Master.
That's quite considerate of you.
Yes, in a way, that trolley is my most trusted partner,
so I am rather concerned about how it's doing.
More than that though, without that trolley,
I can't bring you dessert and tea at the same time.
To be honest, that's what I find most upsetting.
Ade and I have a conversation about how efficient trolleys can be.
This is something of a random question,
but what kind of girls are you into?
Someone who is reliable and professional.
Someone cute and bubbly.
So you like people who share the same traits as yourself.
I've always considered you both reliable and professional.
You are as well, Ade.
Really?
Hehe, I'm glad you see me that way.
Sounds like Soda is more your type.
Cute and bubbly would certainly be apt descriptors for her.
It's too bad I'm not like that...
Ade and I have a conversation about our ideal partners.
One of our customers professed that he was a diehard fan, and asked for an autograph.
I've never given an autograph before, though.
How should I sign my name?
Write it down neatly, in block letters.
Write it down in flowing cursive.
That should be simple enough.
Just a moment.
*Scribble scribble*
Like this?
Perfect.
Hmm...
I've never tried writing like that before, but I'll give it a try.
*Scribble scribble*
Like this?
Er... maybe we can try another way.
I help Ade figure out a pleasing signature.
Watching Cocoa do her ketchup dance
always lifts my spirits, hehe.
Do you like it too, Master?
I'm not a fan. She always splashes ketchup all over the place.
Of course, I love it.
Oh dear...
I suppose you're right, she does tend to make a mess.
I should have been faster cleaning it up.
It's my fault, I apologize.
Hehe, I knew that's what you'd say, but I still wanted to ask.
I've seen you grinning from ear to ear whenever you watch her dance.
Cocoa will be delighted to hear that's how you feel.
Ade and I have a conversation about Cocoa's ketchup dance.
Do you prefer food
that you have to dip in sauce,
or ones with sauce drizzled on top?
I prefer dipping.
I prefer to have sauce drizzled on top.
That's perfect,
because I prepared a fondue.
If you want the full flavor experience, you should dip the baguette into the cheese before digging in.
I hope you enjoy it.
Oh...
Well, I prepared a fondue, but it might be difficult to eat it if you pour the cheese.
Sorry to disappoint you.
No need to apologize. I'm sure I'll enjoy it.
I finished the fondue that Ade had prepared.
Where does Soda get all her energy?
Maybe it's because she's so happy.
Because she's a straightforward person.
Hehe, that's an interesting thought.
Maybe I'll ask Soda about it next time.
I wonder how she'll react.
Is that what you think?
I thought it was just because
she's such a positive person.
Ade and I find ourselves both thinking about Soda, which puts us in a good mood.
Master,
when you've visited the Maid Cafe,
has there ever been anything that made you feel uncomfortable?
One time, Soda tripped and spilled a tray full of drinks on my lap.
Nope. It's perfect every time I visit.
Oh my goodness!
That must have been a real hassle for you.
Allow me to apologize on her behalf.
You're too kind.
Thank you for always seeing us in a positive way.
I hope you'll continue to visit us often!
We'll be waiting.
I have a conversation with Ade about the service at the cafe.
I'm a perfectionist when it comes to providing flawless service.
Oftentimes, however, Cocoa and Soda seem to have a hard time with this.
There are moments when I worry that I may be demanding too much from them.
What do you think, Master?
Having that attitude might make them feel a bit stressed.
I also won't accept anything less than perfect.
You think so?
I suppose I haven't been terribly considerate of their feelings.
Thank you for the advice, Master. You've been very helpful.
I'm glad we're on the same page.
It's nice to know that you're on my side, hehe.
You're such a kind person, Master.
Ade heads back to the cafe with a satisfied expression.
It's rather peculiar...
Whenever I'm with you, I always feel at peace.
Why do you think that is?
Maybe it's because we're such good friends.
Maybe it's because you feel you can trust me completely.
I can tell you for certain that
that is not the case.
I've never considered you to be just a friend.
Wow!
It's like you're peering straight into my mind.
I've always trusted and relied on you.
There's no one else I would wish to serve more than you.
I spend a peaceful moment with Ade.
I'm always so grateful to make your acquaintance, Master.
I really would like to be able to show you my gratitude.
Is there perhaps something that you want in particular?
I'd like to take you out.
I'd like a coupon for some free food at the Maid Cafe.
Would that be enough?
Very well, I'll try and arrange for some time off as soon as I can.
I'll let you know as soon as I find out.
This is so exciting, hehe!
I'm looking forward to it.
Oh, well... sorry, that's not really something I can decide on my own.
Soda, Cocoa and I all manage the Maid Cafe together,
so I'll have to go back and discuss it with them.
Ade and I continue our conversation, with me offering more ideas on things I want.
*Rustle*
I'm sorry, Master.
I didn't mean to wake you.
I was trying to cover you with a blanket, but...
Sorry, I must have dozed off.
I was in the middle of a wonderful dream...
Hehe, it's all right.
You're more than welcome to sleep here whenever you're tired.
Getting proper rest is important.
Why don't you head over to your bed, though?
I'll go get you some fresh sheets.
I really am sorry for disrupting your sleep.
I'll be more careful next time.
You don't quite look well-rested yet. Why don't you sleep a little longer?
We end our session prematurely, due to my fatigue.
I've just drizzled some ketchup on the omurice.
Would you like me to say the delicious spell?
Wait for Ade to enchant the spell.
Recite the spell yourself.
May this dish be delicious♪ May this dish be delicious♪
Thump thump boing♡
Hehe, I kind of thought that you would join in.
May this dish be delicious♪ May this dish be delicious♪
Thump thump boing♡
Oh my goodness,
you memorized the entire thing.
Well, I'm sure your omurice will be extra delicious now, hehe.
Indeed, the omurice proved to be exceptionally delicious.
One of our regular customers said that
he wanted to see us in different uniforms.
What do you think of that?
I don't think anything can top your maid uniforms.
Actually, I'm curious to see what you'd look like in casual clothes.
I feel the same way.
A maid uniform goes hand in hand with providing the best service.
It's the look that I personally prefer.
I'm glad you understand that.
So you're curious as well?
All right, I'll try on something different next time.
I'm a bit worried though, because I'm not used to wearing something casual.
I have a conversation with Ade about outfits.
What do you usually do on your days off, Master?
I usually hang out in my room and relax.
I go out and about.
It's nice to have a relaxing day in,
but I hope that you'll find it in you to visit our cafe sometimes.
Things always seem a bit dreary here without you.
Then you can drop by the cafe
on your next day off!
I guarantee that we'll provide you with the best service you've ever experienced.
I'm looking forward to seeing you.
Ade and I have a conversation about the importance of rest.
Coach, I'm curious:
What kind of cheerleading style do you like best?
The proficient kind that involves a lot of skill.
The explosive kind that involves a lot of energy.
... I see.
If we want to improve our overall skill level,
Rewind will have to put in a lot of hours.
You feel that way too?
That's what our fans told us.
They said that
our energy is what they love most.
I'm happy to hear that you think that as well.
I share insights about cheerleading with Bay.
I washed my uniform,
but I can still pick up the lingering smell of sweat on it.
It was so bad that I couldn't focus on practice.
Do you have any foolproof methods to completely get rid of the smell?
Use a detergent specially designed for sportswear.
Try handwashing.
I didn't even know
there was such a thing.
You know everything, Coach.
Coach...
Once practice is finished, I don't even have the strength to lift a finger.
How could I possibly handwash my clothes?
I'll just try changing the detergent.
Bay and I contemplate the ideal method of doing laundry.
Go! Go! Victory!
Go! Go! Victory!
When I arrive at the Commander's Room, I see Bay practicing in front of a doll.
What are you doing?
You can do it!
Coach, how long have you been watching?
For a little while now.
*Gasp*
I feel a bout of stage fright coming on...
C'mon, team, give it your all!
Bay finishes her cheerleading routine.
You know how our cheers go?
Of course.
You're a fast learner, Coach.
Here, I'll do another routine just for you.
Go! Go! Victory!
I sit back and watch Bay practice.
Coach, what do you think is the most important virtue a cheerleader should have?
A genuine desire to cheer others on.
Be big and bold with your voice and gestures.
I think so as well.
Sure, it's important to be big and bold with your voice and gestures,
but the most important thing is for your heart to be in it.
That's important too,
but shouldn't having a genuine desire for cheerleading be the most important thing?
Well...
I thought you'd know that...
I have a conversation about the virtues of being a cheerleader with Bay.
If we cheer others on,
who cheers for us?
Other cheerleaders?
I'll cheer for you.
Is that meant to be a serious answer?
That's not the most comforting thought...
I didn't necessarily ask for it, but I certainly won't stop you from doing that.
But...
How are you planning on cheering me on?
Er... just out of curiosity,
that's all.
Bay and I ruminate on being a cheerleader.
It seems like audiences these days are more into the concession stands than our performances.
Do you feel the same, Coach?
I can't resist a good snack.
How could I possibly find time to eat a snack while watching you all perform?
I see.
It hurts to hear that snacks take precedence over me...
I knew you would feel differently.
I hope you'll continue to support me going forward.
Bay and I have a conversation about the threat of stadium snacks.
Clay and I are going to watch a movie. What genre would be good?
A suspense film.
A high school film.
Hmm...
It's my day off, so I'd like to watch something a bit more light-hearted.
Do you have any other suggestions?
Ooh,
that might be a good idea.
One where the main protagonist is a cheerleader.
I'm sure Clay would enjoy that too.

Thanks, Coach.
I have a meaningful conversation about movies with Bay.
Sometimes I feel like Clay is too prim and proper.
She'll still greet me with,
"Yes, ma'am" and "Will do, ma'am."
It's all a bit stolid.
*Sigh*
I just want things to be more casual and easy. What should I do?
How about a company retreat for the squad?
It'll resolve itself with time.
I don't know about that.
That might make it
more pronounced than it is now.
Then she'd never shake the habit.
Will it?
Sure. You're a good person, and easygoing.
You really think so?
I'm not so sure myself,
but I'll follow your advice and wait.
Bay and I discuss how she can become closer to her fellow teammates.
Rewind fans are always saying that my beauty marks are charming.
How about you, Coach? Which of my beauty marks do you find most alluring?
They're all equally charming.
The one beside your breast.
All of my... beauty marks...!
Even if you talk so nicely, I don't have anything I can specially do for you.
But Coach.
Specifically, what beauty mark do you think... is charming?
... Can you tell me one by one?
You creep!
Bay and I have a conversation about beauty marks.
Bay sits staring silently at the wall with her arms crossed.
Is there something on your mind, Bay?
Oh, hey, Coach.
It's just that whenever I look into the audience, I start to get short of breath.
Will I ever be able to overcome this crippling stage fright?
You can do this.
Don't say things like that. You're better than that.
I never said I couldn't do it.

Hearing you cheer me on does make me feel rejuvenated.
... You're right.
I know that
cheerleaders shouldn't let their negativity show.

sometimes I just need a few words of encouragement from you.

There's nothing like a long shower after a strenuous session of practice.
Even better if I've got some nice-smelling body wash on hand.
On that note,
I was wondering if you could recommend a particular scent that suits me?
A strong and musky scent.
Something sweet and sugary, like candy.
Strong and musky?
You make it sound like I'm cut out of granite.
I didn't realize that's the image you had of me in your mind.
You think something sweet suits me?
If anything, I'd say that more suits Clay.
I'm not sure,
but if that's what you recommend, I'll give it a try.
Bay and I have a conversation about body wash scents.
I really want to win first place in the upcoming cheerleading competition.
What song do you think would leave a strong impression?
An energetic pop song.
A propulsive rock ballad.
That seems good.
I've already got several songs in mind.
I should start practicing right away.
Thanks, Coach.
Hmm...
That might be a bit much for cheerleading.
If we were to go with that style of song, we might leave an impression different from the one we want.
Never mind. I'll discuss with Clay what song we want to use.
I have a conversation with Bay about which song to use during cheerleading.
*Sigh* I feel like my stamina has been really lacking lately.
I need to get in better shape.
What kind of exercises do you think would be good?
Walking.
Breathing exercises.
Hmm... that could work.
There's no better exercise than walking.
Would you like to do it together?
I-if you don't mind, I would be happy to...
Does that really count as exercising?
If I lean on that, I'll end up so out of shape I won't be able to climb a flight of stairs.
*Sigh*
That's it, you and me. The practice room. Tomorrow.
We're going to get some exercise.
Bay lectures me on the importance of exercise.
Coach, we have a big problem.
We lost all the pompoms at the stadium.
I'm taking this opportunity to buy new ones.
What color do you think is best?
Black, dark as the blackest night.
Pink. It goes well with the Rewind uniform.
... Have you been in touch with Guillotine by any chance?
A while ago, yeah...
No wonder.
*Sigh* I'll discuss which color we should use with the other team members.
I figured you might say that.
That is the safe choice.
I was thinking about changing it to black to spice things up,
but it's hard to imagine Rewind without pink pompoms.
Very well, I'll follow your advice.
I have a conversation with Bay about pompoms.
Tomorrow is a rest day, and we don't have a match or practice.
I want to take this opportunity to eat something delicious.
What do you recommend I have for dinner?
Foods that can replenish energy.
A salad with chicken.
I don't know...
Seems a bit high in calories.
Can't you recommend something lighter?
You're right.
If I want my cheerleading to be flawless,
I should maintain a healthy diet even on a rest day.
I knew I could count on you for solid advice, Coach.
Bay and I discuss dinner menus.
Who do you think would be a good additional member of Rewind?
Someone who would help us put on a truly amazing performance.
Volume.
What about me?
Volume?
Coach,
you do realize that teamwork is essential for a good cheerleading team, don't you?
Volume is a solo act. Why don't you recommend someone else?
You?
Hmm...
That... might work.
Would you like to stop by the practice room later tonight?
Bay and I brainstorm about which new member to recruit.
Coach,
have you ever envisioned how I would look in other clothes?
What style do you think would suit me best?
A sophisticated two-piece suit.
A hip street look.
You don't think I'd look too formal?

It would be nice if you could recommend something more low-key.
Hip...? Me?
Do you really think that would suit me?
I think it might look awkward on me, but if that's what you think,
I'll try it once.
Bay and I have a conversation about what fashions are trending.
I can't stand rainy days!
What about you, Coach? What kind of weather do you like the most?
Cloudy weather.
Sunny weather.
I'm not a fan of cloudy weather either.
Whenever it's overcast out, the crowd isn't as jazzed up.
*Sigh*
It's always tough to bring their energy back up.
You're like me.
The weather has to be nice for the crowd to get excited,
and that always feeds into our own energy.
Of course, we always put our best foot forward regardless of the weather, but...
I have a conversation with Bay about the weather.
You must have already mastered the cheerleading skills, right, Coach?
How about I quiz you?
What do you call when you stand on one leg and stretch your other leg out behind you?
Absolute.
Arabesque.
... As expected.
I knew you hadn't mastered your cheerleading knowledge yet.
*Sigh* Fine.
Starting today, I'm going to give you some special training on cheerleading theory.
Let's head to the practice room, pronto.
Wow, that's correct.
I actually wasn't expecting you to get that right.
I guess you really have been studying cheerleading.
Then again, I should have expected that you would know everything.
You're so cool.
I have a conversation with Bay about cheerleading skills.
Sorry that I'm late.
As Bay frantically rushes in, I notice that she has bandages all over her leg.
What's wrong with your leg?
Oh, it's nothing.
This is just part of everyday life for a cheerleader.
I see. So it's kind of like a badge of honor?
I hope you didn't get hurt.
I guess so...?

You're not... worried about me, are you?
Of course I am.
Er...
... Thank you, Coach.
I'll practice more so I don't get hurt.
Bay and I discuss the ways in which cheerleading can be done safely.
When you're cornered, forced to extreme measures for a goal,
what's your move?
I'd always look for another solution.
I'd brace for the fallout, whatever it may be.
... Another solution, hmm?
Ideally, that would work.
But the world is far from ideal.
Sometimes, tough calls are mandatory,
lest you lose everything in your indecision.
Indeed.
Confronted with a dire choice,
you need to stand ready for the ripples it causes.
The world seldom offers us the luxury of perfect outcomes.
I have a bittersweet counseling session with D.
Someone once asked me
why I favor the axe
over the convenience of a firearm in my line of work?
Do you know the reason?
To avoid leaving evidence.
Because missions aren't meant to be a walk in the park.
That's not it.
The traces I leave are none,
regardless of the tool I wield.
That's not why an axe is my instrument of choice.
Precisely. Missions aren't all about ease.
That was my answer to them as well.
The axe reminds me of the mission's gravity, a burden I choose not to disregard.
I have a deep conversation with D.
To convincingly play the part of newlyweds,
I checked out a luxury apartment where Sovereigns live for recon.
The fancy decor made it look nice at first glance.
Do you want to live in such a place?
Not really.
Sometimes I kind of want that.
I think so too.
Living in luxury seems pointless to me.
What's inside you matters more than what's around you.
I see.
But I doubt its true value.
I have a discussion with D about luxury apartments.
D comes in disguise.
What's with that look?
Is there any problem?
I just realized how beautiful my wife is.
It's odd seeing you in disguise without a mission.
Oh, Honey.
I appreciate the flattery,
but I'm getting into character for an upcoming job.
How about you help me out with some practice?
This time, you're going to act as...
I rehearse scenarios with D.
When a Sovereign moves in,
what's their usual gift for the neighbors?
Flowers, or something practical?
Flowers.
Something practical.
That fits
since Sovereigns are all about appearances.
... So, which is more appropriate?
Genuine blooms or the everlasting kind?
Practical, huh?
It doesn't seem like something a dignity-obsessed Sovereign would opt for.
I need to think about this.
D mulls over this new puzzle.
I notice a tattoo on D's arm.
What's up?
That tattoo on your arm... What's it about?
... Nothing.
The butterfly one here?
You seem fixated on it, despite claiming otherwise.
Are you curious about this butterfly tattoo?
It stands for transformation, but through death.
A personal marker for why I'm on this path.
A constant reminder to myself.
You get it, right?
I have a conversation with D about tattoos.
Honey.
My husband?
... Too formal, isn't it?
D is lost in thought.
What's on your mind?
Honey works fine.
I'm working out how to address you during the mission.
It'd help me act more naturally.
Any suggestions?
Being too formal might look weird for us.
Good call, Honey.
... Yeah, that's better.
I sort out nicknames with D.
Here, take this.
D hands me a heavy bag.
Check it out when you're on your own.
... Got it.
... Nothing dangerous in here, right?
It's full of disguises.
You'll need to get a feel for them before we get going.
Remember, a good disguise is half the battle.
Practice with them in front of the mirror until it feels right.
Dangerous?
I don't know what's running through your head,
but it's just full of disguises, nothing dangerous.
The reason I said to check it alone
is to keep the mission under wraps.
Sorry if I wasn't clear enough.
I learn more about disguise from D.
On weekdays... we do this... and on weekends...
D is writing something down.
I think it's crucial we have our story straight before the mission,
so I'm putting together the backstory for our cover personas.
The paper is brimming with all sorts of backstories.
Is it necessary to be so detailed?
I'll make sure to memorize as much as possible.
Without a solid story,
we're bound to slip up.
We can't let some minor mistake blow our cover.
So, tough as it is, you need to commit every detail to memory.
Please do your best.
It's essential for the mission
that we know our cover as well as our own lives.
I work hard to memorize what D wrote.
It's time for our session, but D is nowhere to be seen.
*Zing*
Honey, what do you want for dinner?
Anything you make is good for me.
I've already eaten, actually.
Good.
Not the response I'm expecting,
but still works.
*Sigh*
Remember to always stay in character, no matter the circumstances.
That's how we avoid slip-ups during a mission.
Here, study these menus.
If you can't improvise, at least memorize them.
She hands me a list of dishes.
I receive an acting lesson from D.
It's time for our session, but D is nowhere to be seen.
*Zing*
You're back, Honey! How was your day?
It's been a long day. What about you?
Erm... I actually just sat around all day.
Hehe, I've been awaiting your return.
That doesn't feel quite right. Perhaps...
Honey, I'll go wash up first.
This sounds more natural for newlyweds, don't you think?
I'm not entirely sure about this role, so just go with it.
*Sigh*
Remember to always stay in character, no matter the circumstances.
That's how we avoid slip-ups during a mission.
Here, study these lines.
If you can't improvise, at least memorize them.
She hands me a paper with several lines of dialogue.
D and I act out a scenario as newlyweds.
It's time for our session, but D is nowhere to be seen.
*Zing*
Honey, is there something you want for our anniversary?
Just some downtime.
How about you? What would you like to have?
D puts her hand on her axe.
I-I mean, downtime with you, of course.
... Next time, you'd better prepare a better answer.
Answering a question with a question. I like it.

turning the tables with a counter-question can be a clever tactic.
Even so, you should always have an answer ready too.
I crafted the backstory for our anniversary with D.
It's time for our session, but D is nowhere to be seen.
*Zing*
Out of nowhere, D comes dangerously close to me.
Honey,
what's with the red stain on your shirt?
H-huh? Red stain? Where?
Oh, that? I must have spilled wine on myself.
Could it be lipstick from another woman?

D slaps me on the cheek.
Wine, you say?
D puts her hand on her axe.
Yeah, we had wine together yesterday, remember? I must have spilled some at that time.
Oh, that's right.
D relaxes her hold on the axe.
Give me your shirt, Honey. I'll wash it right away.
I have a terrifying time rehearsing as newlyweds with D.
It's time for our session, but D is nowhere to be seen.
*Pitter-patter*

*Zing*
D comes in completely soaked by the rain.
... Can you give me something warm?

Just black and bitter.
... I'm fine.

D's squirming bag keeps bothering me.
You seem fixated on my bag.
D stares at me quietly.
N-not really.
What's in it?
*Sigh*

D places the bag before me.

as evident from its distinctive logo...

I learn more about luxury brands from D.

What's our move if the target figures out we're in disguise?
Stop the mission, right?
Take the target down?
Exactly.
We'd have to stop the mission, unfortunate as it is.
We need to investigate the facts,
and only then can we make a move.

If you select the Ace of Hearts, you win. If you select the Ace of Spades, I win.
Which one will you choose?
Left.
Right.
Ace of Hearts.
How did you know?
I just had a feeling.
Hehe.
Ace of Spades.
I win this time.
Would you like to play another game?
I spend some time playing a simple card game with Rouge.
I get to meet a wide variety of customers
when I'm working at Coin Rush,
and sometimes it's hard for me to control my emotions.
What do you think I should do?
Don't hold back, and say something.
Try and hold it in to stay professional.
Is that right?
Somehow I think that would only
make the situation worse.
I was thinking the same.
If we raise our voice in Coin Rush,
the customers would feel uneasy,
especially if it was coming from the Game Master.
Rouge and I talk about how to deal with difficult customers.
We want to prepare a unique prize for an upcoming event,
but nothing is really coming to mind.
Do you have any good ideas?
A Mustang plushie.
Some rare jewels that won't break the bank.
Boss is a well-known figure, sure,
but surely we can come up with something more alluring than that?
Mmm, eye-catching and opulent prices are sure to attract customers' attention.
Thank you. I think that's a great idea.
Rouge and I discuss the prizes for Coin Rush.
Even though we're all part of the 777 Squad,
we rarely run into each other when we're on the job.
I'm worried that we might lack the cohesion you'd find in other squads.
You all could meet up in the main hall.
Maybe the reason you all don't need to see each other often is because you trust each other.
That's not possible.
If the Game Zone staff leave their posts too often,
it would put a burden on the remaining staff members.
I see.
I trust them, and they trust me as well.
That's why we're all capable of doing our best in our respective positions without checking in on each other.
Thanks for the encouragement, Highroller.
Rouge and I discuss the cohesion of her squad.
Let's see if Lady Luck is on your side today, Highroller.
*Clink*
Rouge flips a coin and catches it.
All right, take a guess:
Heads or tails?
Heads.
Tails.
Rouge opens her hand.
It's heads.
Hehe.
Looks like you'll have good luck today.
Rouge opens her hand.
It's tails.
You'd better be cautious today.
Rouge and I check on my luck for today.
Coin Rush offers a wide variety of games and activities,
so people come here for all sorts of reasons.
What brings you to Coin Rush, Highroller?
To play games.
To watch performances.
Hehe, thank you.
Since you frequently visit for the games,
I'll do my utmost to ensure you receive top-notch service.
I see.
Watching performances is also a good choice.
However, I do hope you'll visit the Game Zone after the performance.
Rouge and I discuss the reasons people visit Coin Rush.
Have you ever had those days where
you're on top of everything,
yet nothing seems to go your way?
What do you do on days like that?
I keep going until I win.
I stop and head home.
Hehe, I'd like to praise your persistence,
but if you're too obsessed with winning,
it could cloud your judgment.
That's a wise decision.
Even though it may be just a game,
a bad losing streak can take a real toll on the mind and body.
Rouge and I discuss what to do on days when you keep losing.
I had a really absurd dream yesterday.
Blanc, Noir, and I had to swap jobs.
I think Bunny Rouge and pole dancing is a pretty good idea.
I think being a Game Master suits you better.
I don't think I have the talent for that.
I doubt I'd be able to hold out for long.
That's what I think too.
I can't ever imagine myself doing a different job,
especially one like Blanc and Noir's.
Rouge and I have a conversation about the dream she had last night.
I work at Coin Rush every day,
so when a rare holiday comes around, I'm not sure how to relax.
Honestly, I haven't had any memorable holidays so far.
How about going outside and getting some exercise?
Isn't doing nothing the best vacation of all?
I'd like to make the most of my holiday, but...
I'm not sure if that's the ideal choice.
Why not?
Exercising isn't exactly my thing.
Sorry? I'm not quite sure what you mean.
Not having any memorable holidays means you've done a good job at resting.
I suppose a holiday should be just that: a break from work.
In other words, relaxing is the best way to spend a holiday.
Rouge and I talk about how to spend the holidays.
Whenever I observe the customers,
I notice that Coin Rush attracts people from all walks of life.
If I weren't a Game Master,
what career do you think I would have ended up in?
A member of the Maid Cafe?
A pro gamer.
I am confident in my ability to entertain customers,
but isn't there more to that job than that?
Yeah, you'd have to spend a fair bit of time reciting spells to make food more delicious.
I'm not sure I'm built for that.
That's a job that requires quick judgment and a bit of luck.
It might be a good fit for me.
Rouge and I discuss which job might suit her.
Opinions differ on what plays a bigger role in winning.
What do you think, Highroller?
Skill is more important.
Luck is more important.
Of course, skill is important,
but from my experience,
even the most honed skills can be rendered useless by a stroke of good luck.
You and I think alike.
No matter how polished your skills are,
if luck isn't on your side,
you're bound to plunge into the depths of failure.
Rouge and I discuss what is most important for winning a game.
We're conducting a survey at Coin Rush, so I have a question for you.
Are you satisfied with the service we provide?
Of course. It couldn't be better.
Actually, there is something I'm not entirely happy with.
Thank you.
We'll continue to be attentive and
dedicated to maintaining the quality of our service.
Which part do you think needs improvement?
It's almost too perfect, which might actually be a flaw.
... Highroller, this job is my livelihood, so I'd appreciate it if you refrained from joking.
Sorry.
Rouge and I have a conversation about the service at Coin Rush.
If Coin Rush offered a prize
that could grant any wish of the winner,
what would your wish be?
A supercar and an opulent mansion on Royal Road.
I'd wish for one of your wishes to be granted.
I didn't realize you were so...
materialistic.
I was just kidding.
My wish?
I didn't expect you to give that type of answer. I don't know what to say.
I... I'm honored that you were thinking of me, Highroller.
Rouge and I talk about what wish we would make.
Some people are such gaming fanatics, that they come to the Game Zone every day.
While we appreciate that our customers enjoy our games,
we do worry sometimes that they may be addicted.
What should I do in this situation?
Try offering different types of games every now and then.
Put a limit on how long they can play.
For example, games that are more active and physical.
Hmm... That sounds like a good idea.
It might also be helpful to have them enjoy various cultural activities here.
Thanks for the advice, Highroller.
Hmm... I'm not sure about that.
Sure, they're less likely to become obsessed,
but I think we'd end up getting complaints afterwards.
Rouge and I brainstorm on strategies for dealing with customers who are too absorbed in the games.
I've been working on my spelling lately.
Being a librarian and all, it's something I ought to have down pat.
On that note, I wanted to test you and see if you know whether this is spelled correctly or not.
Phantom shows me a piece of paper with 'haresmen' written on it.
Uh... what is this?
I can tell you confidently that it's spelled incorrectly.
I thought you'd have a good grasp of spelling.
I guess I was mistaken.
This is the word "harassment".
I've spent my entire life spelling it this way, only to discover it was wrong all along.
You'd do well to remember this spelling.
I knew you'd be good at this.
I've spent my entire life spelling it this way, only to discover it was wrong all along.
The correct spelling is apparently "harassment".
I've got to remember that well.
Phantom and I spend some time studying spelling.
What do you think is the most important trait for a thief to have?
N-not that I have any ulterior motives or anything!
I just figured you were a fan of thieves, so I was curious to hear your thoughts.
A sense of justice.
A determination not to get caught.
I knew my instincts were right!
I'm so stoked that I finally have someone to talk to about what it means to be a thief.
I agree with you wholeheartedly.
It's imperative to have an unwavering sense of justice, a desire to punish the wicked and support the righteous!
Hmm...
Of course, that's important too,
but if you only focused on that, you'd be little more than a petty thief.
I thought you understood the difference between a noble thief and a common criminal.
Could you maybe elaborate more on your thoughts?
Phantom and I have a passionate discussion about thieves.
I'm here.
What shall we talk about today?
... What's with the mask?
Sorry, who are you?
Mask...?
Oh, um... this...
*Ahem* I must have taken a wrong turn somewhere.
Well... I'll be going now!
Oh dear, I must have taken a wrong turn.
I'd kindly ask you to forget you saw me today, young man.
I'm sure we'll meet again some time.
Adios.
Phantom disappears without a trace.
I can't believe how many evil people there are in this world.
It pains me how much good people suffer.
How can we make the world a fairer place?
We just have to keep working at it.
No matter how hard you try, making the world a fair place is still pretty tough.
You're right.
We must keep punishing the wicked and standing up for the righteous.
If we do that, I believe the world will be a little better than it is now.
Your answer is a very practical one.
But even if that's true...
I want to keep trying.
I want to make the good people in the world just a little happier.
So, will you join me in this effort?
I have a serious talk with Phantom.
My squadmate Arcana gives me a Tarot reading every month.
The cards say that living honestly and with integrity is the right path, but it's also bound to bring plenty of danger.
You'll be out late at night more often, so you must be extra vigilant.
What do you think?
Doesn't sound like you at all.
It describes you to a T.
Haha, I thought so too.
What danger could there possibly be for a mere librarian like me?
And why would I be out late at night so often?
I know others have said her Tarot readings are eerily accurate, but I don't think that's the case for me.
I-is that so?
But what danger could there possibly be for a mere librarian like me?
And why would I be out late at night so often?
This is really hard to understand.
Does this mean I'll be working late and coming home in the evenings?
Phantom and I talk more about Tarot cards.
There haven't been too many new stories about thieves lately.
I wonder why that is?
Maybe there isn't enough interest from the public.
Maybe they're about to drop something amazing.
How could you say that?!
Sure, it's true that we don't have many people around us who are into thief novels,
but surely there are countless fans out there!
There must be some grander reason behind the recent lack of new stories...
You make a good point.
Lately, all the stories have been so fluffy.
This is the perfect time for a sensational masterpiece!
Oh boy, this is great! I'm getting so excited now!
I have a chat with Phantom while waiting for new stories about thieves.
I have a request for you.
There is a place I must be tonight, and I need some time to prepare.
Could we end our session a bit early today?
Take me with you.
Okay, I understand.
You want to come with me?
That... might be somewhat difficult.
It's dangerous... and it'll be quite late...
Er...
Are you really sure you want to come with me?
Thank you so much.
I appreciate you not asking any questions.
I hope that one day I'll be able to tell you everything.
I wrap up my session with Phantom earlier than originally scheduled.
Do you happen to know how to fold a paper airplane so that it flies far?
I have been folding it as I learned from a video online,
but I'm curious if there's a better method.
I know someone who's a pro at paper folding.
Want me to show you?
No way!
I had no idea such a thing existed.
Please introduce me to them the next time you get a chance!
Oh, you're going to show me yourself?
I really appreciate that.
*Swoosh* *Swoosh*
Hmm...
It looks more like a paper ball than a paper airplane...
I spend time making paper airplanes with Phantom.
Do you know?
Even in libraries, there are shockingly nasty patrons.
They will fold pages, scribble in books...
But that's not even the worst thing.
People who give spoilers?
People who tear out the most exciting pages?
No, that's not it.
Of course, if someone were to reveal the culprit on the very first page of a whodunit,
it would undoubtedly ruin the reading experience.
Still, depending on the reader, this might be forgivable, so it's not the worst offense.
Yes! That's exactly it!
I'll be utterly engrossed in the story and fully caught up in excitement...
only to find that the entire climax has been torn out of the book!
I'll be dying to know what happens next, but I'm unable to keep reading!
When all the excitement is shattered, and I'm left feeling empty,
it's truly… a moment I never want to experience again.
Phantom and I discuss the horrible ways people behave in the library.
Sorry I'm late.
I went somewhere el...
*Plop*
Wh-where did those come from? I'm sorry, let me pick these up real quick.
Help Phantom pick up the calling cards.
Wait for Phantom to pick up all the calling cards.
No, no!
I-I'll get them. You stay right there.
Don't move, don't even look! Just stay exactly where you are!
Phew...
Thanks for waiting.
I have an enjoyable session with Phantom.
In the books I've read, thieves use all sorts of things to outsmart their pursuers,
such as magic, gadgets, tricks of all kinds.
I'd love to learn something like that... just as a hobby, of course.
Can you do anything like that?
Show Phantom a thumb-removing magic trick.
Show Phantom a simple mirror trick.
Whoa!
That's so creepy and cool!
However...
It's not really a trick a thief would use.
Whoa!
How did you do that?
I might be able to use that someday!
... As a party trick, I mean.
I spend time showing Phantom some simple magic tricks.
The police in the Ark seem to be quite competent,
especially the A.C.P.U. squad. They're really impressive.
Who do you think is the most reliable member of the A.C.P.U.?
Poli.
Miranda, maybe?
You think so?
Most people think that Poli is the most capable in the squad,
but I think otherwise.
Miranda is more righteous and considerate of the citizens than anyone else I know.
At heart, she's a true thie... Er, I mean, police officer.
Most people would choose Poli.
But looks like you think the same way I do.
Miranda is more righteous and considerate of the citizens than anyone else I know.
At heart, she's a true thie... er, I mean, police officer. Hehe.
Phantom and I spend some time praising Miranda.
Hmm...
This is just a hypothetical question,
but what would you think about me becoming... a thief?
I think it would suit you really well.
I don't think it'd be much different from now.
R-really?!
Ahem!
Thank you for the compliment. If I ever cosplay or something,
perhaps I'll consider dressing up like a thief... hehe.
Really?
Um... is that supposed to be a compliment?
Does that mean I already seem like a thief?
Or is that a roundabout way of saying it wouldn't suit me?
I spend time talking with Phantom about thieves.
The more I read these books about thieves,
the more I think I can write one myself. So I gave it a try.
... Would you like to read it?
Phantom hands me a stack of papers, the first of which is labeled "The 102 Menings of Bing a Thiaf".
Uh... sure, I guess.
Could you possibly run a spell check on this first?
Thank you.
I'd love to hear your feedback when you're done with it.
It's a novel about the mindset and beliefs that I think a thief should have.
I hope you find it enjoyable.
So earnest is Phantom's expression that I couldn't bring myself to even mention the idea of asking for a spell check.
Oh, sorry about that.
I always do the spell check at the very end.
Once you've read it and given your feedback, I'll make the final revisions based on that
and then run a spell check.
Anyway, thanks for taking the time to read it.
As I read through Phantom's writing, I feel my head start to spin.
I saw a news report stating the decline of people's reading habits.
Maybe that's why it's been so quiet at the library.
What can we do to encourage more people to read?
Increase the variety of books.
Promote the library by holding various events.
We already have plenty of books.
We're the largest library in the entire Ark, with a wider variety of books than anywhere else.
I think what we really need to do is capture people's interest.
For example, we could transform the library's interior with a thief-themed decor.
Oh, that's a good idea.
Libraries often get a reputation for being quiet and stuffy.
But if we promote and hold some events, we could pique others' interest and also lighten up our image!
A thief-themed event sounds fun, don't you think?
I spend time with Phantom brainstorming how to increase people's reading.
So, tell me,
if you were to become a thief, would you prefer a mask or a cape?
Definitely a cape.
A mask, no question.
I feel the same way too.
Of course, since a thief must conceal their identity, a mask is essential.
But the image of a cape fluttering in the wind... it's just too cool to resist!
Hmm, is that so?
Of course, since a thief must conceal their identity, a mask is essential.
But I really do love the image of a cape fluttering in the wind.
I believe this is where the charm of a thief lies.
Phantom and I have a serious discussion about capes.
I'm not saying that thieves are necessarily good people,
but some people might see them as no different from common criminals.
In order to change this perception, we need to raise more awareness about thieves.
Do you have any good ideas?
Let's give out thief novels for free.
Let's make a commercial about a thief's exploits.
No, that won't work.
Giving out books to people who aren't interested in them
would be doing the authors of those novels a disservice.
There must be a better way.
Hmm... That seems like a good idea.
Commercials are designed to promote, and even those who aren't initially interested might come across them by chance.
This could lead to a new realization for them.
That's a smart suggestion!
I spend time with Phantom thinking of ways to raise awareness about thieves.
People often think that reading a lot makes one seem intelligent.
As a librarian who reads every day, when you look at me,
what first comes to your mind?
Er... kn-knowledgeable?
A nerd obsessed with thieves.
Haha, you're a terrible liar.
I know I'm not the most intellectual person out there.
Next time, just be honest. It's a bit awkward watching you stumble over your words like that.
... But thanks for saying it anyway.
You're nothing if not brutally honest.
Yes, I know that's what people think of me, and I personally like that.
It's unique, and certainly more interesting than just being called smart.
That's why I like the current version of myself more than the future me, when I'll just be considered knowledgeable.
Phantom and I talk about ourselves.
I recently started reading detective novels.
They certainly have some interesting plots.
Are you reading them to better understand the enemy?
Are you finally interested in something else other than thieves?
That's right.
Detectives are the sworn enemies of thieves.
I started reading these books to get a better grasp of my foe, and they've been even more useful than I anticipated.
I'll be stocking up on more detective books for now, so if you're interested, come by and read some.
What do you mean by that?
There's no way I would ever be interested in detectives.
They're the main foe of a thief.
I'm reading them to better understand my enemy.
... Only in the capacity of an avid reader of thief novels, of course.
I spend time talking with Phantom about detective novels.
Do you know countless movies, comics, and cartoons about thieves exist?
It's not just books.
Of course, I knew that.
Wow, I had no idea.
R-really?
But why… why did you not tell me?
I… I only discovered this recently…
It feels as though my world… is crumbling around me…
Really?
As expected, it's not easy to experience cultures outside of reading.
So, why don't we explore them together, one by one?
How about starting with comics? They seem to be the most familiar, after all...
I talk with Phantom about various forms of media related to thieves.

Advising Cinderella: 01
Take a look at me, Prince.
Tell me, what do you think of me today?
You're beautiful.
You're very impressive.
An acceptable, but somewhat typical answer.
I hope for a more delightful remark next time.
Anyone can give a perfunctory compliment such as that. It's beneath you, Prince.
A perfect compliment!
I thought the same thing whenever I looked in the mirror.
I often find myself admiring my own exquisiteness.
Are you not curious about how ravishing I can become?
Cinderella and I have a discussion about her beauty.
Advising Cinderella: 02
There's something I'd like to ask you.
Do you think that there is such a thing as sublime beauty?
Yes. You.
No, I don't think so.
I despise such soulless and hackneyed lines.
They are far from beautiful.
... Sorry.
You're right.
I knew you'd share my thoughts on the matter.
There is no such thing as perfect beauty.
That is precisely what makes it all the more resplendent.
Cinderella and I have a discussion about beauty.
Advising Cinderella: 03
There are many stories in this world,
and every story will have an ending.
What kind of ending do you prefer, Prince?
Happy endings.
Tragic endings.
As do I.
A happy ending is the only way to properly bring a beautiful story to a conclusion.
A tragic ending can never be considered beautiful.
No matter how enrapturing the story that unfolds before us,
only sorrow would remain for a tragic ending.
Cinderella and I conclude the session by sharing stories about happy endings.
Advising Cinderella: 04
Hmm?
There's a smudge on the mirror.
I'll replace it with a new one.
I'll clean it so it looks brand new.
I appreciate the gesture, but I'll pass.
If I were to replace this mirror with another one simply because of a small smudge,
it would never have a chance to improve itself.
I believe it's important to give things the opportunity to beautify themselves.
Thank you, Prince.
Thanks to you, this mirror has learned something today.
Although its pulchritude was besmirched due to this smudge,
by wiping it away, it will shine even more beautifully than before.
I spend time helping Cinderella clean the mirror.
Advising Cinderella: 05
Whenever I look in the mirror, I think about how truly beautiful I am.
And what about you, Prince?
How impressive my muscles are.
How it gives me motivation to get through the day.
You don't seem used to receiving compliments from others about your appearance,
but when you're alone, you sometimes get lost in your own comeliness.
What a beautiful thought.
A very positive and passionate statement.
Does that mean you check the mirror only in the morning?
Someone as handsome as you should check the mirror more often.
Make it a habit to look in the mirror ten times an hour.
I talk with Cinderella about the habit of looking at mirrors.
Advising Cinderella: 06
Grave is truly beautiful.
I cannot understand why she insists that she's compromised.
What do you think of her, Prince?
After all she's done to protect you, it's clear she has a wonderful heart.
I can't really tell because of the helmet.
You're right.
Beauty doesn't just come from the outside.
True beauty lies within.
Helmet?
Oh, I see what you're saying. Yes, external beauty like mine may be more visually apparent,
but true beauty lies within.
It is the same with me.
That's why Grave is so magnificent.
She is beautiful both inside and out.
Cinderella and I talk about how beautiful Grave is.
Advising Cinderella: 07
Hmm...
I feel like my appearance is somewhat lacking today.
What do you think is the problem?
You've become so beautiful that the mirror can no longer capture it.
You seem as beautiful as ever to me.
Perhaps that could be it, yes.
The mirror's reflection is not as insightful as your eyes, Prince.
So, it turns out I am, in fact, more beautiful than ever.
Thank you. I'll come to you whenever I feel I can't trust the mirror.
No.
Consider how often I look into the mirror. I can notice the minutest changes.
I'm telling you that I'm not as beautiful as I was yesterday.
But why?
I spend some time complimenting Cinderella and her beauty.
Advising Cinderella: 08
Who do you think is the fairest of them all?
Myself excluded, mind you.
Then there's no one else to choose.
There are too many to choose from.
You're lying.
Even so, it still feels rather lovely.
A lie perhaps, but a beautiful one.
Truly.
I appreciate your honesty.
Yet, there are moments when concealing the truth can be more beautiful.
I have to go.
Cinderella prematurely ends our counseling session.
Advising Cinderella: 09
People often say that one side of our face is more beautiful than the other.
It's said that the more beautiful side is the one where your smile first graces your face.
So tell me, which side of my face is the more beautiful of the two?
Both sides are equally beautiful.
The left side is more beautiful.
A person's face cannot be 100% symmetrical unless they're a mannequin.
Prince.
Have you really taken a good look at my features?
That wasn't a very beautiful answer.
Is that so?
Hmm...
When I smile, it does seem to feel more natural on my left side.
Perhaps that is the side that is a bit more alluring.
Thank you for your lovely answer, Prince.
For the rest of the session, I spend it observing Cinderella's countenance.
Advising Cinderella: 10
There simply aren't enough mirrors around here.
How about bringing in 10 more?
Um... All right, I'll order them.
I'll consider it. Give me some time...
Hmm.
You say that, but you seem so displeased as if you're agreeing against your will.
If you don't really want to have more mirrors around, there's no point.
All right.
Don't worry, I'm not forcing you.
It's just that I feel you don't admire your own beauty often enough, Prince.
That's why I suggested you do it more often.
Cinderella and I discuss how many mirrors should be placed in Reclamation Site 01.
Advising Cinderella: 11
So much time has passed,
and yet they haven't given up.
Are you talking about Grave?
Are you talking about humanity?
Grave has indeed never given up on me,
but I'm not talking about her right now.
I was referring to all of humanity, and you especially.
Despite all that has happened, you have not given up.
You're right.
This nightmarish war, which began before I was ever born,
could have been more than enough to lead humanity to despair and defeat.
But neither you nor the rest of humanity has given up.
That is truly a beautiful thing.
Cinderella and I take a moment to admire our surroundings and get lost in thought.
Advising Cinderella: 12
I want to change the interior of this place a bit.
Do you have any good ideas?
Marble floor.
Glass sculptures.
That's a fine idea.
As I walk, my face will reflect on the floor,
so I'll know how to hold my head to look even more beautiful.
If you take a perfectly fine piece of glass and turn it into mere trinkets, I won't be able to see my reflection in it.
It'll loses its purpose as a mirror, becoming just another ornament.
To me, such meaningless decor is far from beautiful.
We finish our session by imagining potential interior designs for Reclamation Site 01.
Advising Cinderella: 13
You seem like you have something on your mind.
I had a dream.
A dream from long ago.
Quietly wait for Cinderella to continue.
Gingerly hand Cinderella a small mirror.
It was quiet and lonely in the dream.
Even though I kept shouting, no one could hear me.
I'm glad.
My reflection now is far more beautiful than the version of myself I saw in the dream.
It's such a relief.
I comfort Cinderella and conclude our session.
Advising Cinderella: 14
Wh-what is this?
This mirror is so strange.
Why does my head look so big?
Hehe, surprised? I just swapped it with a convex mirror.
Maybe your head really has gotten bigger.
I see.
That's just perfect. I can see my face in greater detail now.
I can examine each beautiful part more closely.
Thank you, Prince. It's such a special gift.
Prince.
Are you serious?
No, I'm just kiddi...
Could my face really get so much bigger? All in a single day?
This isn't beautiful... It must be a dream....
I proceed to explain the convex mirror to Cinderella.
Advising Cinderella: 15
If...
If I had joined the Goddess Squad back then,
how do you think the world would have changed?
Humanity would have been able to reclaim the surface much sooner.
Honestly, I don't know.
I see.
If I had fought alongside those beautiful beings, we would have defeated the Queen with ease,
and gradually erased those hideous Raptures.
Yes. You'd have no way of knowing
just how beautiful I was when I was alongside the Goddesses.
I'm sure things would have turned out differently.
And then...
our beautiful story would have come to an end.
After listening to Cinderella's story, I conclude our session.
Advising Cinderella: 16
Can you help me comb my hair, Prince?
My hair keeps getting tangled today, and it's really bothering me.
Comb it gently from top to bottom in sections.
Comb it from top to bottom all at once.
*Swoosh* *Swoosh*
You're quite good at this, Prince.
Have you had much experience combing long hair?
You're able to untangle all the separate strands beautifully.
Thank you, that should do it.
*Swoosh*
You did well... up to a certain point.
It seems you're not very familiar with handling long hair.
If you comb it all at once, it'll only become more tangled and cause pain.
I spend the rest of the session combing Cinderella's hair.
Advising Cinderella: 17
Prince.
Do you not like me calling you that?
Anis often regards it with a peculiar gaze.
No, it's fine.
How would you feel if I called you Princess?
I see.
Then I'll continue to call you Prince.
Hmm...
I prefer you simply call me by my name.
It feels a bit… unusual to be called Princess.
Hold on... is this how you've felt whenever I call you Prince?
Perhaps I should change the way in which I address you then?
Cinderella and I have a discussion about how we should address each other.
Advising Cinderella: 18
Prince, what would you do
after we reclaim the surface?
Find somewhere peaceful and rest.
Throw an epic party.
You and I feel the same in that regard.
I want to bask in the newfound peace we've won
at a place where the horizon meets the cloudless sky.
Of course, with mirrors, Grave, and you, Prince.
That's a bit different from what I'd prefer.
Loud celebrations aren't always beautiful.
I want to bask in the newfound peace we've won
at a place where the horizon meets the cloudless sky.
I talk with Cinderella about the future.
Advising Cinderella: 19
I have individuals I long to see,
though I'm uncertain of their whereabouts or whether I'll ever have the chance to meet them.
If you were in my place, would you go out and try to find them?
Of course. I'd go right away.
I'd only set out looking for them once I was absolutely sure I'd be able to meet with them.
I see.
You would venture out, even when there's uncertainty?
It is reckless and foolhardy.
... But that is precisely
what makes you so beautiful, Prince.
You're right. That would be the safer option.
You wouldn't have to take unnecessary steps.
But what if...
something were to happen to them while I was trying to gather some proof?
I wrap up the session with Cinderella.
Advising Cinderella: 20
Cinderella is staring blankly at the mirror.
You're beautiful today as well.
You're more beautiful than ever today.
You're right.
I am beautiful today.
How is it that I can be so breathtaking day after day?
I find this most satisfying.
In saying that,
you're implying that I wasn't as beautiful yesterday.
So tell me, what was it about me yesterday that was not beautiful?
That way, I can ensure my beauty remains flawlessly consistent every single day.
I end the session while admiring Cinderella's beauty.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 01
Instructor, which do you prefer?
My new outfit,
or my old one?
The clothes you're wearing now suit you better.
The old outfit suits you better.
I knew you'd agree!
I think these new clothes suit me much better.
It's like... they brighten my face, you know? Hehe.
Really? I'm surprised to hear you say that.
I think my current outfit is more flattering on me.
Those old clothes were so dull. I didn't like them all that much.
Oh well, to each their own.
Quency and I talk about outfits.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 02
Instructor, I have a new dream.
Guess what it is!
Becoming my girlfriend?
Becoming a phantom thief?
Ha, that's not a bad answer,
but that's not it.
Ding ding ding! Correct!
How did you know?
My dream is to become a phantom thief. After trying it a few times, it seems right up my alley.
But it might change in a few days! Hehe.
Quency and I talk more about our dreams and aspirations.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 03
This outfit is a bit tight on me,
so it's not the most comfortable thing to wear.
Putting it on is a bit of a hassle,
but I really like it and want to wear it more often…
How about losing some weight?
I'll help you put it on whenever you need.
Instructor! Don't you know how rude it is to say things like that to a lady?
Besides, I'm already quite slim as is!
Hehe, so you'll lend me a helping hand?
Really? Truly? All right then!
I'll come and find you whenever I want to wear this.
Quency and I talk about clothes.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 04
I'm thinking of creating a new route to the Commander's Room.
Any ideas on where it should go?
To the bed.
To the shower.
Oooh, then I could watch you while you sleep!
That'd be awesome, hehe.
I better get started straight away.
The shower?
Um...
But what if I enter at an... awkward time?
On second thought, I guess I wouldn't mind that... but would you be okay with it? Hehe...
Quency and I talk more about her new potential route.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 05
Instructor, is there any chance we could wrap up our session early today?
I have somewhere I need to be, and it's rather urgent.
You're not up to any funny business, are you?
You can go right now if you need to.
Huh?
Do I look like the kind of person who'd do something like that?
It saddens me that you see me that way, Instructor.
Huh? You're letting me go without even asking why?
That's why I like you, Instructor!
We still have some time, so I'll stick around and chat a bit more!
Quency and I have a pleasant counseling session together.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 06
If I run into Guilty or Sin while I'm wearing this outfit,
what should I tell them?
I figured it'd be a good idea to think ahead.
Just say you wanted a change of pace.
Maybe it's better to be honest.
Hmm. I don't think they'd believe me.
Besides, it could also lead to more misunderstandings.
Is that so?
... Maybe you're right.
One lie usually leads to another.
Quency and I talk about Guilty and Sin.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 07
I've been pretty busy wandering around these past few nights, and I'm exhausted.
These changes to my daily schedule really wear me out.
Would you like to take a short nap?
Would you like an energy drink?
I'm not sleepy, but fatigued.
I think I'm just a bit tired. A little break should do the trick!
When did you have time to prepare this?
Wow, I was really feeling worn out, so thanks a bunch!
That really hit the spot. I'm feeling a lot less tired now!
Quency and I talk about fatigue.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 08
You won't believe what happened today.
Phantom misspelled my name as "Quincy".
To be fair, that's an easy mistake to make.
You should write her name out as "Phantim" in return.
What? How could you possibly mix up "Quency" and "Quincy"?
They're totally different.
Don't tell me you get them mixed up as well?
Hehe, that sounds fun!
Acting this way may be a bit childish,
but I can't forgive her for getting my name wrong.
Quency and I talk about names.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 09
Whenever I'm with Miranda and Phantom,
I lose track of time. Why is that?
Maybe because they wear you down so much.
Maybe it's because you're having so much fun.
You think so?
I do get distracted easily.
It totally drains me at times...
Wait! What am I saying? I have a blast whenever I'm around them, so much so that time always seems to fly by.
Just sitting back and watching them is the best form of entertainment, haha.
It's definitely fun being around those two.
It's like having front-row seats to a comedy show.
Hehe, just thinking about it makes me happy. I guess you're right, Instructor.
Quency and I talk about Miranda and Phantom.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 10
Instructor.
If I were to wear another new outfit,
what would you like me to wear?
A skintight dress.
A casual pair of jeans.
A dress? I've never worn one before!
It's a bit hard to imagine, but then again, I do like skirts!
If that's what you want, I'll try it someday.
Jeans?
That doesn't seem like it'd be much different from what I'm wearing now.
Is there anything else? I prefer skirts!
Quency and I talk about clothes.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 11
I went to the mall today, and it smelled absolutely fantastic!
*Growl*
Oh boy.
I'm famished.
Let's go get something to eat.
Want me to cook you something?
Ugh... I'm so ravenously hungry,
I don't even think I have the strength to move.
Don't you have anything to eat here?
Really? That sounds awesome!
To think I get to taste your cooking! I can't wait!
It almost feels like we're newlyweds.
I cook a delicious meal for Quency, which we share in the Commander's Room.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 12
Whenever I go out, people are always staring at me.
Why do you think that is?
Probably because they think you're pretty.
Probably because of your outfit.
Oh, really?
I do feel like my looks have been on point lately.
It's nice that everyone recognizes how pretty I am. Jeez, that sounds awfully arrogant, doesn't it? Haha.
Why? What's wrong with my outfit?
I don't think it's that. Maybe they're looking at me because they find me pretty, hehe.
Quency and I have a meaningful counseling session.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 13
I've been trying to come up with a cool calling card.
Something concise, but memorable.
What do you think I should write?
The Escape Queen is coming soon.
At 3 AM, be prepared.
Are you being serious?
Don't joke around!
I am serious.
... Fine. I'm leaving.
Oh, that's actually pretty good.
You think so?
Yeah, I like it!
I should suggest that to Phantom the next time I see her.
Quency and I talk about what to write on a calling card.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 14
I am Quency, the Phantom Thief.
We are the ones who uphold justice in the Ark!
The Thieves of Justice!
I knew you'd join right in!
We really are in sync!
It's no wonder you and I get along so well.
Why aren't you saying anything?
You should shout, "The Thieves of Justice!"
You're not embarrassed, are you?
Quency and I talk about the Thieves of Justice.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 15
Instructor!
You saved all those bottle caps, didn't you?
Sorry. I threw them out a few days ago.
Here. These are all of Anis' soda bottles.
What?! How could you?!
... Okay, fine. I guess it's understandable.
I've been more focused on my thieving activities than those at the Rehabilitation Center.
Don't these belong to Anis?
Are you sure it's okay to give me all these?
Just collect the bottle caps and give them to me whenever it's convenient. It's nothing that I need urgently.
Quency and I have a pleasant counseling session.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 16
Instructor, how do you relieve stress?
I don't know if it's because I've been running into some bad apples lately,
but I feel like I'm under so much stress.
I talk about it with my friends.
I get some sleep.
Can I talk to you then, Instructor?
I'm super stressed right now!
So, what happened was...
It's the stress that's keeping me up!
I just can't stop tossing and turning.
They don't say stress is the root of all evil for nothing.
Quency and I talk about stress.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 17
Please let me be a righteous thief again today.
Quency closes her eyes and prays earnestly.
All right, I'll allow it.
That might be quite difficult.
Hehe, thanks for the permission.
Since I have your consent,
I'll be even more diligent and teach all those bad guys out there a lesson.
Huh? What makes you think that?
Can't you just give me permission?
Hold on... why are you the one getting to decide this anyway?
Quency and I have a quirky counseling session.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 18
You always look so handsome whenever I see you, Instructor.
I almost want to steal your heart.
I am a thief after all, so maybe I should, hehe.
The thing is, you've already stolen it.
You might have a hard time running off with it.
Really? When did I do that?
You've stolen my heart too, Instructor.
Does that mean we're both feeling the same feelings?
Nothing is too hard for me.
I'll show you how quickly I can steal your heart.
I could do it in under an hour.
Quency and I have a meaningful counseling session.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 19
Instructor,
are you busy today?
For you, Quency, I have all the time in the world.
Yeah, I'm a bit busy today.
Hehe, really?
Then let's go on a date.
On the way here, I passed by a place I would love to go to with you.
Can't you spare just a few moments?
There was this place I wanted to go to with you.
Okay, fine. I guess I'll go alone.
Quency and I have a meaningful counseling session.
Advising Quency: Escape Queen: 20
Hmph!
Don't talk to me.
Okay.
Did I do something wrong?
I don't understand how you're so popular with women, Instructor.
It's obvious that I look upset. Aren't you curious why?
Hehe, no.
I just wanted to see how you'd react.
And just as I thought,
your reaction was adorable!
Quency and I have a meaningful counseling session.
Advising Grave: 01
I have something I want to ask.
What do you think when you see Cinderella?
That she's beautiful.
That she's a princess.
That's right. She is beautiful.
Even after waking from sleep, her pulchritude remains undiminished.
Isn't that simply amazing? I'm so happy for her.
A princess?
I'm no sure what makes you say that,
but I suppose Cinderella is as ravishing as a princess, yes.
Grave and I have a conversation about Cinderella's beauty.
Advising Grave: 02
Rapi, Neon, Anis...
When I look at you all, memories of some individuals come to mind.
Their faces are blurry, but they were precious to me...
Despite that, I can't even remember their name.
... It makes me feel ashamed.
I know it's hard, but there's not much you can do.
I'm sure you'll remember their names some day.
... You're right. There's nothing I can do about it now.
So, until they and I are reunited and I get to hear their names once again,
I'll simply have to keep feeling bad about it.
I will?
... I certainly hope so.
If not, I'll just keep feeling sorry until I can see them again and hear their names.
Grave and I contemplate ways to recall precious memories.
Advising Grave: 03
Hmm...
Hmmmm...
Grave fiddles with her helmet, which covers only half of her face.
Is the helmet uncomfortable?
Does it feel awkward to only have half the helmet remaining?
It feels strange to me, that's all.
I think it will take some time to get used to.
You're amazing!
It's like you can read my mind!
That's right. It feels a bit strange to have a helmet that only covers half my face.
That's why I keep touching it.
I adjust the helmet with Grave.
Advising Grave: 04
Superhuman,
do you think that our fates are predetermined?
I think so.
I don't think so.
Even if that's the case,
I must try and rewrite our story anyhow.
I refuse to let Cinderella's story end in tragedy.
I must push forward
and believe that our story is destined for a happy ending.
I see. That's a relief.
If our fate is predetermined, I thought it might be difficult to rewrite our story.
If it's a path that hasn't been set in stone, then it's fine.
We can rewrite it as much as we want.
Grave and I have a conversation about our future plans.
Advising Grave: 05
Sometimes, it doesn't feel real that Cinderella has opened her eyes.
It's as if everything up to now has been a dream,
and when I wake up, I'll still be carrying her coffin while wandering around the Crystal Region.
This is no dream. This is reality.
This is a dream.
Yes, indeed... Hearing such words does give me reassurance.
But I still have no small amount of anxiety.
You are completely different from any other human I've known.
Perhaps that's why sometimes, I feel like you're from a dream.
I... I see.
It's as I feared.
Cinderella waking up, humans helping me... It's all a dream.
Then how do I wake up...?
Er... Sorry. I was only kidding.
Is that... so?
If you don't believe me, go ahead and pinch yourself...
Like my cheek?
*Pinch*
Grave pinches her cheek hard.
That hurts!
It feels like I nearly pinched off a chunk of my cheek!
Ah, I see. The pain must mean that this is reality.
I rub Grave's cheek.
Advising Grave: 06
Superhuman,
why are you up on the surface?
To create a happy ending with my comrades.
I'm not so sure myself.
So that is your dream as well?
I believe you'll be able to achieve it.
You are no ordinary human, so it is possible.
If you cannot achieve it with your own strength, then I will help.
So, make sure to create a happy ending.
You still don't have a goal?
In that case, you must decide now.
When putting your life on the line, your goal must be crystal clear.
Otherwise, you will be swept away by the vagaries of the world.
I hope that doesn't happen to you.
Grave and I have a conversation about reclaiming the surface.
Advising Grave: 07
Whenever Cinderella says I'm beautiful,
I don't really know
how to react.
Tell her that she's even more beautiful.
Just accept the compliment.
Yes, that's brilliant.
That way, I neither acknowledge that I'm beautiful nor deny what Cinderella is saying.
You're really smart.
I'll do exactly as you say. Thanks.
What do you mean?
Beauty is something that applies to someone like Cinderella,
not for the likes of me.
I... am not beautiful, so I cannot say I am.
Grave and I have a conversation about beauty.
Advising Grave: 08
I have a question.
What do you think of Cinderella?
She's a strong Nikke.
She's a beautiful Nikke.
Strong?
Is that how you see Cinderella?
... I suppose that's also correct,
but for me, rather than her strength,
her noble and beautiful inner self is what stands out most.
Oh!
I feel the same way!
Cinderella is beautiful.
Yes, she possesses overwhelming strength, but it is her noble heart and sense of conviction
that is most beautiful.
Grave and I have a conversation about Cinderella's beauty.
Advising Grave: 09
People say that the world has changed a lot since Cinderella was asleep.
I have no memories, so I cannot attest to whether that is true or not.
Do you think the world has changed much?
Just look at all the machines we have and you can see how much has changed.
Nah, not really.
That's a good point.
One glance at all the machines you've brought with you is enough to see how things have changed.
You're quite smart, Superhuman.
So nothing has changed?
But the machines you brought with you are different from before.
Then it seems that the world is indeed changing.
I want to look into these changes a bit more.
Then somehow, I feel like we can end this interminable war with the Raptures.
Grave and I talk more about the world and how it's changed.
Advising Grave: 10
You said that you know our predecessors.
I'm curious.
How are they doing?
They're still fighting for humanity.
One is a drunkard, another eats bugs, and the other is always obsessed with finding lewd stuff.
... I see.
Even after all this time,
they're still continuing the fight.
They're living on, holding fast to their noble convictions.
That's really beautiful.
Who are you talking about?
I asked about my predecessors.
The people you're talking about hardly sound like the stuff of legend.
Legends don't live such slipshod lives.
