No, our party has no need for such simple quests.
Don't you remember, Partner?
We didn't vow to tread a path of roses together, but a path of hardship!
Hehe. Good idea.
No matter how difficult the quest, it won't be a problem for our party.
Let us walk the path of hardship together!
... Can you tell Maiden for me?
Guillotine and I head to the dungeon.
Advising Guillotine: Winter Slayer: 19
Guillotine closes her eyes and recalls the past.
Partner...
If the One-Winged Dark Lord were to consume me, do you think Maiden could defeat it?
... She would fulfill her duty as a member of the Extrinsic.
... She would honor her role as your friend.
I hope so.
Members of the Extrinsic must separate personal and professional matters,
and remain calm and collected while they fight for the Ark.
... Heh. I'm not so sure Maiden could do it.
... Heh. That's what I think Maiden would do as well.
Her feelings would get in the way, and she wouldn't be able to kill me.
So, I ask of you...
If the time comes, you must be there for Maiden, so that she can defeat me.
Guillotine and have a serious conversation.
Advising Guillotine: Winter Slayer: 20
Guillotine closes her eyes and recalls the past.
Partner.
What do you want to do once this adventure is over?
Go on another adventure.
I want to rest alone in a quiet place.
... Hehe.
Hahahahaha!
Yes, a true adventure never ends!
There is never a dull moment when I'm with you.
So you are planning to end this journey in solitude?
If so, I, Guillotine de Mephisto, will be with you all the way.
... That's not having peace and quiet alone.
Oh, right, hehe. I missed that part.
Still, wouldn't it be better to do it together?
Guillotine and I envision the end of our adventure.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 01
I've been ruminating about a personal matter.
Commander, do you think it's wrong to be greedy?
As long as you don't go too far, I don't think it's a problem.
It's not good to be greedy.
So, as long as it's not excessive, it's okay.
I'll keep that in mind.
Keep it in mind?
You're right.
I'll try and only be as minimally greedy as needed.
Huh?
Anyway, do you remember what happened during the last operation?
Anis and Neon...
Rapi and I proceed to have a normal counseling session.
However, after the session is over...
Rapi doesn't seem willing to leave.
Um, Rapi, our session is over.
I know.
... Can we talk a little longer?
I spend the night talking with Rapi.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 02
It's time for our counseling session, but Rapi hasn't shown up.
I wonder if everything is okay...
*Zing*
Sorry for being late.
I spent a lot of time looking for an item I misplaced.
I even roped Neon into helping me, but I haven't found it yet.
I can help. Calm down, and let's look for it methodically.
If you really can't find it, why not just get a new one?
Together, you mean?
Thank you.
... I can't do that.
It's something uniquely precious to me.
What is it that you're searching for?
... A photo.
A photo? Of what?
Of you and me. Just the two of us.
I help Rapi look for the missing photo.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 03
Neon and Anis were at each other's throats again today.
They were bickering over who would get the last chocolate bar.
I'm a bit worried. It feels like they've been fighting more than usual.
I'll talk to them.
Why don't you teach them a lesson?
No. I'll handle it.
You tend to go too easy on them when it comes to this stuff.
I'm not their superior.
However, since you've entrusted me with the authority to enact this order, I will faithfully carry it out.
Hold on, I never gave any orde...
I'll be right back.
Rapi takes a deep breath and leaves the room.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 04
Commander, what's your definition of a comrade-in-arms?
Irreplaceable individuals whom I cherish deeply.
Allies who fight together towards a common goal.
I feel the same.
The more people like that around you, the better.
Being alone can be very isolating.
Really?
I think that people can fight alongside each other even if their goals differ.
Rapi and I discuss various things which we cherish.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 05
Anis has arranged a gathering to celebrate a successful operation.
Would you like to go together, maybe?
I'm kind of tired, I think I'll rest a little.
Sure. Let's get going.
Okay. I will let Anis know.
Rapi picks up her phone.
Sorry, but we won't be attending.
You're not going either?
I just remembered some paperwork that I have to do.
I thought you said you'd finished it all this morning.
Something new came up.
Sure.
Do you drink, though?
It's not my favorite thing, but I know how to.
You just drink it and swallow. That's all.
Let's get going.
Rapi extends her hand.
Rapi and I spend some time together.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 06
Do you remember when I told you how difficult I find eating the same food several days in a row?
What did you tell me then?
I told you you're welcome to vent your frustrations with me anytime.
I told you to suck it up and eat.
About that...
I was thinking there was something else I wanted to vent to you about.
Would you be willing to listen for a moment?
I gave the same advice to Anis and Neon,
but they've been complaining more than ever.
Do you have any idea why that might be?
I listen to Rapi's concerns.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 07
I know I've been busy with operations lately and haven't visited often, but there seems to be an awful lot of dust gathering in the Commander's Room.
I should probably clean, shouldn't I?
That means you need to come visit me more often.
Let's get straight to it.
I'll call in Anis and Neon as well.
Actually, never mind. That'd only give us more work than is necessary.
Yes. Understood.
Having said that, we should really clean this place up, you and I.
Rapi and I clean up the Commander's Room.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 08
Something strange happened this morning.
I heard a loud banging sound from the shower in the Commander's Room, even though no one was in there.
Then, not long after, another strange booming sound came from near the table.
Do you have any idea what could be behind those noises?
It's a ghost that is obsessed with a certain video game. I'm sure of it.
Commander?
Why aren't you answering?
Commander?
I've told you before that I don't believe in ghosts.
... I don't.
Not one bit.
*Bang*!
Are those the strange sounds you were talking about?
I just remembered that I have something urgent to take care of.
Rapi hurriedly scurries out of the room.
Looks like Elegg was here.
I enjoy some BOOM alone.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 09
Commander, how do you usually spend your free time like today?
I usually pass the time quietly on my own.
Let's go outside.
... Is that so?
I must be interrupting you, then.
Not at all. I'm glad to have someone accompany me.
Very well, then I'll stay.
Excuse me?
Let's go for a walk.
... Sure.
Will you offer me your hand this time as well?
Rapi and I spend some casual time together.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 10
It's almost time to eat.
What kind of food do you like, Commander?
I like anything that I get to eat together with you.
I enjoy most things, so long as it's not a Splendamin bar.
With me...
I... I see.
In that case...
How about we go out to eat today?
I totally understand.
Even though the standard of our supplies has improved as of late,
We still end up eating Splendamin bars more often than not.
While we are on the subject, how about we go out to eat today?
Sure.
Rapi and I enjoy some delicious food together.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 11
Commander, what do you look for most in a partner?
What makes you ask?
Someone I can open up to.
Anis asked me a similar question the other day, and I wasn't sure how to answer.
I wanted to ask you the same to get some sort of reference point.
Never mind. You can ignore my question.
Someone you can say anything to?
Precisely. Like you, for example.
Really?
... I have to go.
Rapi quickly leaves the room.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 12
I'm planning on buying some supplies we're running low on.
Is there anything you need, Commander?
Let's go together. I can help you with the shopping.
Could I ask you to get some items I need for the Commander's Room?
Thank you.
I was worried I'd have to go with Anis and Neon.
They always beg me to buy all manner of unnecessary things.
Stuff for the Commander's Room?
As far as toiletries are concerned, you can use the same ones that I buy.
For office supplies, I can go to the usual place that I order from...
Okay, got it. I'll be back.
Later, I sort through the various supplies that Rapi purchased for me.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 13
I overheard some Nikkes having a conversation,
and they said that my personality has changed a lot recently.
Do you think so too, Comander?
Yes, but I think it's a positive change.
I haven't noticed anything different about you.
That... must be
due to the squadmates who are alongside me.
There's a saying that goes:
We are shaped by those around us.
Oh... really?
Anis brought up the notion of a personality test.
Would you like to try it with me?
The one we did during a previous session? Sure.
I spend time with Rapi doing the personality type test.
The results are different from last time.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 14
Rapi is intently focused on choosing a song on the jukebox.
Can't decide?
I've been listening to different genres of music to try and figure out my preferences,
but I'm still not sure what I like.
What kind of music do you enjoy most, Commander?
Country music.
EDM.
Hmm...
That's not usually what I go for,
but since you're a fan, I'll play a song.
EDM you say?
That's a new genre that I haven't heard before.
Okay. I will give it a try.
Rapi and I spend some time sitting in front of the jukebox, listening to music.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 15
Do you have any long-term goals, Commander?
To live a peaceful life.
To reclaim the surface.
The fact that we're able to have peaceful, everyday moments like this
is a testament to how hard we've strived.
I want your goals to become a reality,
so I will do everything in my power to reclaim the surface.
If there is something you want, you should work hard for it.
I'll work together with you
to make that dream happen.
Rapi and I dream of a distant future.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 16
Rapi stares intently at the top of the desk.
What are you looking at?
I was looking at the photo.
I didn't expect it to be here.
Let's take more in the future.
Wouldn't it be nice to have some more photos beside it?
Yes, I'd like that.
Every time I see this one, I feel disappointed at how awkward I look in it.
Having said that, since it's the first photo that we took of just us two,
I will always cherish it.
It would.
Next time, I would like to take one with Anis and Neon as well.
And, if possible, another one of just the two of us.
Rapi and I share a lighthearted conversation.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 17
Yesterday, Neon offered to help me with my paperwork.
She also showed me how more hands can sometimes mean more work.
Well, it's the thought that counts.
I'll help out next time.
True...
But there are times where I'd like to accept the thought only.
Especially when it comes to work-related matters.
Thank you for the offer,
but it would be more efficient if you were to spend time with Neon whenever she offers to help me.
That would be a greater help.
I listen to Rapi's work-related concerns.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 18
Rapi stares intently at the top of the desk.
What are you looking at?
The mirror.
Commander,
do you prefer me as I was before, or who I am now?
Who you were before.
Who you are now.
I see.
I think otherwise.
I like the current me. Unlike before, I have my own stories now.
I think so too.
I like the current me. Unlike before, I have my own stories now.
I would love for us to continue spending more time together.
I want you to see how my story unfolds.
Rapi and I have a heartfelt conversation.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 19
Do you think
there is a meaning in past glories, Commander?
I think they hold great meaning.
I don't think they amount to much, no.
Without past glories, there wouldn't be a present.
As long as you are not trapped by them,
and continue moving forward to find your own path,
previous accomplishments will always shine bright.
Really?
I think that the only reason the present exists is due to past glories.
That's precisely what allows us to decide to move forward.
As long as you're not held back by them, past glories absolutely hold significance.
Rapi and I have a profound conversation.
Advising Rapi: Red Hood: 20
Rapi is closely examining Seven Dwarves Zero.
What's on your mind, Rapi?
I was thinking about how amazing this weapon is.
It's an incredibly powerful weapon, especially the drill bit projectile.
It's well-suited for Red Hood, that's for certain.
I get the same impression whenever I glance at it.
And so, I will do everything in my power to ensure that
this weapon I've inherited can fulfill its role.
Yes. I think so too.
And so, I will do everything in my power to ensure that
this weapon is a good fit for me as well.
Rapi and I talk about weapons.
Advising Trina: 01
The more clothing you wear,
the farther you drift from nature.
To avoid that, we must make a concerted effort to free ourselves from this fabric prison.
Maybe I'll join you.
But what about having a sense of dignity?
Oh my, really?
I knew you would understand.
I can't wait for the day you join me.
What about it?
We're simply returning to the natural state we were born in.
There's nothing to be ashamed or embarrassed about.
I listen to Trina's thoughts on clothing.
Advising Trina: 02
There are quite a few trees by the roadside here in the Ark.
How do they look to you, Sun?
They look very pretty and neatly arranged.
They seem somewhat stifled.
Hmm... is that so?
I suppose they might appear that way at a cursory glance.
But if you listen closely to what they tell you, I think your thoughts would change rather quickly.
I think so too.
They've been stripped of their freedom,
and they're unable to stretch their roots and branches out like they want to.
Trina and I talk more about the trees lining the roadside.
Advising Trina: 03
I had a dream yesterday.
I was running away from someone,
and when they caught me, I transformed into a laurel tree.
What a pleasant dream.
What an awful nightmare.
Haha, you're right.
It really was an exciting and delightful dream.
It felt like I had fully become one with nature.
Is that what you think?
For me, being able to connect with nature, even if only in a dream,
was an immensely satisfying experience.
In fact, I'd love to have that dream again.
Trina and I discuss the dreams we had the previous night.
Advising Trina: 04
I'm due to have a counseling session with Trina soon, but I'm so tired that I can barely keep my eyes open.
It shouldn't be a big deal if I have a short rest.
When I re-open my eyes, my head is resting on Trina's lap.
You're finally awake again.
If you're tired, how about you take it easy for today?
Okay, I'll rest just a little while longer.
No, I should finish our session.
Have a proper rest and fight off that fatigue.
Hehe, you were sleeping so peacefully. You looked like a baby.
Hehe, I figured you would say that.
But my offer still stands; whenever you're feeling exhausted, my lap is all yours.
Afterward, I have a shortened counseling session with Trina.
Advising Trina: 05
The birds above my head all have different personalities.
This means they often quarrel, but they always stick close to me.
Haha, even though I see them every day, they never cease to intrigue me.
Maybe they mistook you for a nest.
You're their family.
Oh, that could be it.
My body is often a resting place for them, after all.
Oh my goodness!
People often throw around the term "pet" when I bring them up, but that's the first time someone has called them family.
You always find a way to touch my heart, Sun.
I talk with Trina about the birds above her head.
Advising Trina: 06
Sun, what's the first thing you'd like to do if you reclaim the surface?
I want to feel the vastness of nature, which is something we can't do in the Ark.
I'd plant an apple tree.
I'd do the same!
What would it be like to immerse oneself in untouched natural surroundings, free from human interference for so long?
When that day comes, please take me with you.
That's a lovely gesture,
but won't there already be plenty of trees up on the surface?
I would want to talk to those trees first.
Trina and I discuss what we'd like to do up on the surface.
Advising Trina: 07
People sometimes say that I seem like an airhead,
or they feel that I'm hiding something sinister behind my friendly demeanor.
Should I try and make some changes to how I act?
It might be worth trying.
Just take your time and let people know who you really are.
But this is who I am.
If I changed my entire personality, then I wouldn't be me anymore.
And even if I did decide to change, I wouldn't know which direction to take.
Hehe, you're right.
I just want to prove to people that this is who I really am.
Trina and I talk about her true nature.
Advising Trina: 08
I want to give a treat to the trees by the side of the road.
What do you think would be good?
How about some liquid fertilizer?
Orange juice, maybe?
The trees would love that!
Thanks for the suggestion, Sun. I'll start preparing it straight away!
Maybe you're not as caring as I thought, Sun...
Trina and I debate on what would make a nice treat for the trees by the roadside.
Advising Trina: 09
All the trees at the Outpost have their own unique traits.
Is there any tree that stands out in your memory, Sun?
I'm not sure. They all look pretty similar to me.
The small tree in the park.
Hmm, I see.
If you take a closer look, I'm sure you'll notice some differentiation between them.
I'll tell you all about it next time.
Oh, you know that tree?
It is diminutive, but so full of spirit and determination.
Next time I see her, I'll have to tell her we were talking about her.
Trina and I continue to discuss trees we find memorable.
Advising Trina: 10
What's the first thing that you associate with trees, Sun?
You can be honest with me.
Warmth and comfort.
Rigidity.
That's exactly how I feel!
In nature, trees are wellsprings of vitality, nurturing all life around them.
If we were to compare them to people, wouldn't they take on the role of a mother?
Haha, I think that's a fair way to look at it.
But if you observe them a bit more closely,
you'll notice that there are surprisingly tender and delicate aspects to trees as well.
Trina and I talk about the sensations that trees evoke in us.
Advising Trina: 11
*Swish*
Trina starts to pull down her clothes.
Hike her clothes back up.
Wait quietly.
Huh? Are you trying to stop me, Sun?
Haha.
I know you're doing it out of concern, so it does feel rather sweet.
You must enjoy being close to nature as well, don't you?
How about joining me?
Today's counseling session with Trina ends quickly.
Advising Trina: 12
Sometimes, the little ones wonder what it would be like up on the surface.
I understand their eagerness,
but the climate on the surface is much harsher than it is in the Ark.
The little ones have already adjusted to this environment, but I worry that their hopes of seeing the surface will be dashed.
I want to help them prepare themselves mentally, but how should I go about it?
How about telling them stories about the surface?
Let's take them up to the surface and give them an experience.
Ah, that's a great idea!
That way, they'll understand that the world can be a harsh place,
and it won't catch them by surprise.
But wouldn't that scare them, doing it all so suddenly?
I realize they seem strong, but they're still quite tender at heart.
I believe we should introduce these things to them slowly.
I talk with Trina bout how to help trees grow from within.
Advising Trina: 13
Sun...
What's wrong?
One of the trees passed away suddenly, even though it seemed perfectly fine not long ago.
... Maybe I don't have what it takes.
You should pay closer attention to their health.
That tree will become nourishment for the others. In that way, it will live on in a different form.
I know... I ought to try communicating more with them from now on.
There might be others who are hiding their pain.
... That's true.
Even in death, that tree will be of help to someone, so I shouldn't dwell only on the sadness.
Thank you, Sun. Your words comforted me a lot.
Trina and I talk about the death of a tree.
Advising Trina: 14
The birds above Trina's head flap about expectantly.
Don't they seem positively ecstatic?
They do seem more excited than usual.
That's because once this session is done, we'll be stopping by Flora's garden.
The little ones always look forward to these visits.
Do they get treats whenever they visit?
Maybe it's Flora that they like.
How did you know?
Every time we stop by, Flora prepares some delicious snacks for them.
Haha, I wonder what she has in store for them today?
Haha, while they certainly are fans of Flora,
I think it's something else that gets them so excited.
Trina tells me more about the birds that encircle her head.
Advising Trina: 15
Trina brings a small bonsai tree to the session.
I've been tending to this little one personally.
It said it has something it wants to tell you, Sun.
Would you like to hear it?
Sure... but I can't really hear anything.
Hello, what's the matter?
"Try cleaning out your ears once in a while,
you insensitive human."
... That's what the little one said.
What did it say?
It's a secret.
Ha, so now you two have your own little secret?
I think I might be a little jealous!
I have a conversation with the tree Trina brought.
Advising Trina: 16
Sun, what do you think about having to trim a tree which has superfluous branches?
Is it the right thing to do?
They need to be pruned.
There's no such thing as an unnecessary branch.
You're not necessarily wrong, but...
If a tree, which cannot speak, slowly extends its branches over time, only to have them cut away in an instant,
don't you find that terribly sad?
I feel the same way.
The very act of exerting itself in order to extend its branches...
I wonder if there's a reason behind it.
That's why I always feel a little sorry when I have to prune the trees by the roadside.
Trina and I talk more about "unnecessary" branches.
Advising Trina: 17
The weather is so nice today.
How about we skip our session and go outside to soak up some sun instead?
Sure, but let's go after our session.
I feel like staying indoors today.
Wow, I didn't think you'd agree so easily.
You always seem so busy, so I thought you'd say no.
Hehe, I can't wait to finish quickly and go outside together.
Staying indoors all the time isn't good for you, you know.
I heard you've been sequestered in your room for days, working on documents.
How about getting some fresh air?
... All right, I'll do that.
Even a little bit of time outside will do you a world of good.
After our session is over, Trina and I head outside to get some sun.
Advising Trina: 18
Sometimes, when I need to check the branches of larger trees, I'm not sure how to proceed.
I feel like I might hurt the trees if I climb all over them...
Do you have any suggestions?
How about using a drone?
Why don't you recruit those birds?
I've tried that,
but it's difficult to get close to the denser trees.
Hmm... this is a real conundrum.
Oh my, that's a great idea!
These birds are small and nimble, so they could check even the deepest recesses of the trees without issue.
And in return, I could prepare some tasty treats for them.
I'll have to ask them for help later.
Trina and I talk about different ways she could inspect the branches of larger trees.
Advising Trina: 19
*Huff*... *huff*...
Sun, could you... please give me some water?
All right.
I bring Trina a glass of water.
Trina is pouring sweat, so I bring her an electrolyte drink instead of plain water.
Phew... thanks, Sun.
On the way here, I saw a tree that was absolutely parched.
I'll go give it some water, and be right back.
Huh? Oh...
I didn't mean for me. It's for a tree.
Could you give me some plain water?
Trina and I commence our counseling session only after she returns from watering the tree.
Advising Trina: 20
Trina is speaking with the birds.
Oh, that's right!
Didn't you say yesterday that you had something to tell Sun?
Huh?
Hey, you guys?
Do they not want to talk to me?
Maybe they're feeling shy?
No, that can't be it.
Hmm... that's strange.
They were positively loquacious all day yesterday.
I'm sorry, Sun. I guess the birds are feeling a little shy.
That seems to be the case, yes.
Are you all too nervous to talk to Sun?
Haha, how adorable.
I try talking with the birds above Trina's head.
Advising Mana: 01
Commander...
Are you someone who tends to trust people easily?
Yes, I am.
No, I'm not.
I thought so.
That's not necessarily a bad thing,
but I believe maintaining an appropriate distance from others can be wise.
Not everyone in the world is good, after all.
I'm surprised to hear you say that,
but I think that's actually a good thing.
Not everyone in the world is good, after all.
I'm the same as you, Commander. I don't trust people easily.
I tend to keep people at a reasonable distance.
Mana and I talk about people.
Advising Mana: 02
They say that everyone has their secrets,
but it's rare to find someone with many secrets.
Commander, what are your thoughts on people who have a lot of secrets?
It can be quite difficult to befriend such people.
I don't feel the need to know all of someone's secrets.
... I see.
I don't think it's necessary to know every last secret to get close to someone.
There are many ways to build relationships with people in this world.
It seems we think alike.
I, too, believe there's no need to know all of someone else's secrets, nor to reveal all of your own.
Also, the more of someone's secrets that you know,
the more burdens you'll have to bear, and all it does is make you think more deeply.
Mana and I talk about secrets.
Advising Mana: 03
Commander, what topic would you like to...
*Buzz buzz*
Sorry, I'm getting a call...
Go ahead and take it.
Okay, thanks.
Hello?
A tense voice comes through the receiver.
...*Sigh* Yes, I'll head over right away to make the corrections.
Pat Mana's shoulder to reassure her.
Want to grab a drink?
... Thank you.
I'm sorry, but could we possibly end our session early today?
There's a document that needs correcting, and it's urgent.
A drink?
Sure, but is it okay if I stop by the lab real quick first?
I'll make a few quick revisions to the document and return shortly.
Mana and I have a pleasant counseling session together.
Advising Mana: 04
We're undergoing performance reviews at the research lab tomorrow.
I've never been nervous before... until now.
This presentation is really important, and I can't help but feel really stressed.
I'll send you some motivating messages.
Would you like to run through your presentation with me?
If I saw an encouraging message from you before my presentation,
I feel like I'd be a little less nervous.
Hehe, thank you.
Right here? Now?
In that case, could you sit there with a stern expression on your face?
Most of the audience members who listen to these presentations are fairly unsmiling.
Mana and I have a meaningful session together.
Advising Mana: 05
Hmm? You look particularly tired today, Commander.
Have you not been able to sleep well?
Want to grab a coffee?
You look like you haven't slept much either. Are you okay?
I'd love to, but a lot of work has been piling up.
How about you take a short nap?
I brought my tablet with me, so I'll be fine sitting here working.
How did you know?
I've been up for two nights straight.
*Clink*
Mana places a drink on the desk.
This is an energy drink I often have when I'm working. It might help you a bit.
Let's drink it together.
I continue our session, fighting off sleep the entire time.
Advising Mana: 06
I've been under a lot of stress lately.
How do you relieve stress, Commander?
By exercising.
By sleeping.
I've heard that exercising is good for stress relief,
but Nikkes don't actually require exercise, so I'm not sure how much it will help.

1. Cool-headed and professional.
2. Friendly and playful.
Cool-headed and professional.
Friendly and playful.
Wow, really?
That's so interesting. That's totally me!
I guess we're meant to be!
Uh... Uh...
Is something wrong?
Oh, nothing.
I kinda thought you'd pick what described me best just to be polite, but I guess not.
But I did.
Huh? You think I'm friendly and playful?
What are you talking about? I'm totally the cool-headed, no-nonsense ice queen type!
I talk with Arcana about my ideal type of woman.

Advising Mori: 01
Why are you being so nice to me?

I don't have any ulterior motives.
... Well, I suppose you being honest is a good thing.
So, what is it that you want?
Stay here today and get a good rest.
What?

That's what everyone says.

If you didn't have much time left,

Bandage her up.

Little Mermaid's Day: 01
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah woo ah.
Today is the same as yesterday.
... It's quiet.
Make bubbles and play.
Quietly look around.
Then a little bit here,
like so...
Ah woo! All done!
*Float*
Little Mermaid finishes creating a bubble which resembles one of her old colleagues.
Little Mermaid sits still for a long time, taking in the silence.
Eventually, she is overwhelmed by a wave of loneliness, and regrets her decision.
Maybe I should just go back to sleep.
Another quiet, uneventful day comes to an end.
Little Mermaid's Day: 02
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah woo...?
Why does it somehow feel different from usual?
Look around and come back.
Tune it out.
Change to background workshop
Little Mermaid enters the workshop and looks at the bubbles slowly floating around.
Everyone is sleeping.
No wonder it's so quiet, hehe.
We can have some fun together when everyone wakes up.
Uh woo...
Ah uh uh woo...
Little Mermaid's mind races and makes her unable to stand still.
I can't stand here. I've got to move and look around.
She finishes her day by looking around for the bubbles.
Little Mermaid's Day: 03
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah uh...
She had a bittersweet and wistful dream.
Longingly call out their names.
Fall back asleep.
Abe.
Cinderella.
Hansel, Gretel.
Levi.
The names that spill out fade into emptiness, unable to cover the crushing loneliness.
She falls back asleep with a peaceful expression,
even though she knows that once she wakes up, her loneliness and longing will only deepen.
Perhaps she's meeting those whom she longs for once again.
A particularly desolate day comes to its conclusion.
Little Mermaid's Day: 04
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah woo ah!
I feel good today.
What should I do?
Take a walk.
Sing a song.
Little Mermaid sets off on her walk with a brisk step.
Ah woo...
Little Mermaid suddenly realizes that her walk is a solitary one, and a sense of loneliness washes over her.
The pace of her gait slows down in step with her feelings as they descend.
It would be nice if there was someone to walk with.
... I should go make some bubbles.
La la la~ La la la la~
Little Mermaid's crisp and mellifluous singing fills the inside of the bubble.
The colorful bubbles sway to the rhythm.
Hehe, everyone seems happy.
Let's sing and dance together until we're exhausted!
And thus concludes another day.
Little Mermaid's Day: 05
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Hmm...
This place could use some decoration.
What should I make with the bubbles?
A large flowerpot.
A beautiful sculpture.
If I do this, and that...
Ah woo!
Standing inside the large flowerpot that Little Mermaid has created, there is a mass of coral and seaweed clumps standing in for blooming flowers.
Ah uh woo... These aren't like any flowers I've seen before.
Have I been down here underwater for too long?
Not satisfied with her creation, Little Mermaid starts making something else.
If I do this, and that...
Ah woo!
A beautiful sculpture.
Fittingly, she has created a statue of Cinderella.
Oh... I didn't plan on making Cinderella...
But,
since it suits this place, I'll leave it, hehe.
Little Mermaid wraps up the day by decorating the interior with bubbles.
Little Mermaid's Day: 06
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah uh?
Wow...
Little Mermaid is captivated by a rainbow-colored fish she's never seen before.
Spend time watching the fish.
Make a colorful fish out of bubbles.
Hehe, so pretty. I could spend ages looking at this little guy and lose track of time.
Wait! Don't go!
The fish swims out and eventually disappears from sight.
Feeling a sense of emptiness, Little Mermaid remains frozen in place, staring at the spot where the fish had last been visible.
I've never seen that type of fish before. I should make one out of bubbles so I don't forget.
But will I be able to keep the colors from mixing together?
If I do this, and that...
Little Mermaid shifts her focus to making a bubble fish, so fixated on her task that she doesn't notice the fish leaving.
She feels a sense of pride as she looks at her completed creation.
And so the day with her new-found fish friend comes to a close.
Little Mermaid's Day: 07
Little Mermaid lies down inside the bubble with her eyes closed.
When I open my eyes, everyone will be standing around me, laughing. They'll tell me this has all been a bad dream.
... Or will it only be dreadful silence, reminding me that this is all painfully real?
Open eyes.
Keep eyes closed.
... Ah uh.
I've been in this strange and unfamiliar place for so long, that it's starting to oddly feel familiar.
It's become my reality, and I have to be brave and face it
It's okay. I can endure this.
Because I can still remember their faces clearly.
Little Mermaid keeps her eyes closed, feeling like she is sinking deeper into the sea.
Deeper and deeper,
until she will disappear entirely, and no reality of any kind will exist.
Ahh!
As Little Mermaid opens her eyes, she is drenched in cold sweat.
Ah, ah uh...
I-it's okay... It'll be okay.
This is how Little Mermaid's day begins.
Little Mermaid's Day: 08
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah uh...
A stream of silver liquid flows past the bubbles.
It's already that time again.
Watch it with caution.
Approach the bubble tree.
There is nothing that will change even if she stares at the silver liquid.
Just swirling and trying to consume each other when it collides with the bubbles.
... Just watching doesn't help.
Is there anything else I can do...
Little Mermaid talks to herself as she places her hand on the bubble tree.
If I want to push it back, I need to make more bubbles.
Please... someone help me.
All that Little Mermaid can do now is offer a small prayer,
but, small as it is, this meager prayer is the only glimmer of hope found in such overbearing solitude.
Little Mermaid spends her day by the bubble tree and silver liquid.
Little Mermaid's Day: 09
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
How long has it been? I wonder.
When I first arrived, I counted the days by stacking the bubbles.
Try to count the days and retrace memories.
Don't think about it.
The tenth year was when I stopped keeping track.
That would mean that now, I've been here...
I don't think I can even calculate it anymore.
Besides, knowing exactly how long it's been would only make me feel more lonely.
Hmm.
I may have to spend more of my life inside this place than outside it.
Best not to obsess over time too much.
Another repetitive day commences once more.
Little Mermaid's Day: 10
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Talk to yourself.
Don't say anything.
Ah...
Ah woo!
It's been so long since I've heard the sound of my own voice.
Hehe, I ought to talk to myself once in a while, or else I might forget how to speak.
For days now...
No, for weeks. Months. Maybe even for years, Little Mermaid has not been talking.
Has she forgotten how to talk with someone else, or has she lost the ability to speak altogether?
She begins her day reminiscing on how things used to be so full of verve and vitality.
Little Mermaid's Day: 11
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Oh, today is the day the breathing hole opens.
Maybe I can send something out.
Stay still.
Send out a bubble doll.
Ah woo...
I better not try anything out of the ordinary.
It could end up causing issues.
I'll just sit back and watch this time.
Little Mermaid pushes down the small shrivel of hope she had...
If a bubble doll manages to get through that hole,
someone might discover me.
Maybe... just maybe... they  could be the ones who find me.
Little Mermaid holds onto that small shrivel of hope...
... and begins her day.
Little Mermaid's Day: 12
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
*Float*
Bubbles approach Little Mermaid.
Huh? You discovered something?
What's this?
Someone's photo album.
Some canned food.
Wow...
Most of the colors have faded, so it's lost a bit of its impact,
but I can still feel the memories contained within it.
If I ever see them again, I'll make sure that we take plenty of photos like this for posterity.
You brought food? Thanks.
I've only been eating when it's absolutely necessary, so I still have enough provisions, but
it never hurts to have more food available.
Little Mermaid kicks off the day by examining what the bubbles brought her.
Little Mermaid's Day: 13
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
A lot was eaten this time.
In particular, I see a lot of Raptures.
Remain hidden and lie low.
Stay alert.
It wouldn't be good to attract attention.
I'll stay as quiet as possible.
... At least until they're all dissolved by the silver liquid.
Considering how many of them there are,
I should stay on guard, just in case.
Soon after.
... Thankfully, none of them seem too interested in the space that I'm in.
Man... I've been so tense this whole time. I'm getting exhausted.
Little Mermaid spends the day keeping a close watch on the Raptures.
Little Mermaid's Day: 14
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah woo ah!
I'm open to doing pretty much anything today.
What should I do?
Clean.
Do nothing.
I'll make this place spick and span.
*Swish swish*
*Rub rub*
There we go. Now it's even cleaner than usual.
What a great feeling!
I think I'll take a day off and get some solid rest.
On second thought, I feel kind of lazy doing that.
I think it's best that I move around a little.
Little Mermaid spends the day filled with energy.
Little Mermaid's Day: 15
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
She finds herself unable to overcome the feeling of crushing loneliness.
Abe is strong. What would she say in this situation?
What are you whining about? Pull yourself together and push through it!
Sometimes, it can be too much for me too.
Hehe.
Yeah, I can see her saying something like that,
all while patting me on the shoulder reassuringly.
... All right. I've got to be strong.
Even someone as strong as Abe
has to go through rough patches on occasion.
But if that's true...
How am I going to be able to make it through this?
Little Mermaid spends the day thinking about her friends whom she misses dearly.
Little Mermaid's Day: 16
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
Ah woo.
Ah uh ah.
I wonder how everyone always understood what I was saying?
They understood based on intuition.
They actually didn't understand.
Yeah, that's probably it.
That means that
they really knew me.
Having friends who truly understand me... it's an amazing feeling.
As crazy as she knows it sounds,
Little Mermaids starts to become paranoid that no one actually understood her, and only pretended.
Ah uh...
She spends the day preoccupied with all kinds of thoughts.
Little Mermaid's Day: 17
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
I don't feel like doing anything today.
What should I do?
Even so, make an effort to do something.
Lie around all day.
Once I get up, I'm sure there will be something I can do.
Little Mermaid forces herself up and feels a crushing wave of exhaustion wash over her.
Ah woo...
She then thinks better of it, and slumps back down on the ground.
Abe always said that rest is important.
I'm also really comfortable lying down here.
I'll rest a little, just for today.
Little Mermaid proceeds to have a rest day.
Little Mermaid's Day: 18
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
... Ah uh ah.
When she meets her friends again, Little Mermaid wonders what the first thing she'll say is.
I missed you.
What took you so long?
If I do ever meet them again,
I'll ask them how they are, and tell them how terribly I've missed them.
Hm... No.
I don't resent them, not even a little bit.
I don't think I'd say that to them.
I'll just... hug them and tell them how much I missed them.
I miss them especially bad right now.
Little Mermaid spends the day longing for her friends.
Little Mermaid's Day: 19
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
*Splash*
A fish breaks through the bubble and falls down.
Uh ah...!
A fish got in! Was this part of the bubble too thin?
Ah...
Levi always liked grilled fish.
Eat some grilled fish.
Keep it inside as a pet, and a friend.
Let's do it.
It's been ages since I had some grilled fish.
Little Mermaid grills the fish and takes a bite.
*Nom*
It's not as good as I remember... maybe because Levi isn't here.
Ah woo!
Little Mermaid scoops up some seawater and puts it, along with the fish, in a small fish tank made out of bubbles.
I'm gonna call you Levi.
It's been ages since I've had someone to talk to.
I'm so happy!
And with that, Little Mermaid's day comes to an end.
Little Mermaid's Day: 20
Little Mermaid wakes up inside the bubble.
In an instant, the blue ocean turns red.
Is it staring at me?
Stare back.
Close your eyes for a moment.
No, I shouldn't do that.
Not yet.
I'm not ready, and I have no idea when my friends will come.
I need to hold on just a little longer.
Little Mermaid slowly closes her eyes.
I'm not ready yet.
I need to wait a little longer.
... I'm sure the right time will come.
With the crimson sea to her back, her day begins.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 01
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Haha, it's always nice when you meet someone you get along with.
Now then, shall we have another conversation today?
Aren't we already doing that?
Sure, what kind of conversation should we have?
I'm sure he was teasing me with that answer, right?
At any rate, if I was the one insisting so strongly on having a conversation,
he must have been someone I spoke to quite a lot, haha.
Hmm... that's all I remember.
I wonder what happened afterward?
I'm sure we had all sorts of deep conversations and completely lost track of time.
... I hope we can meet again someday.
Mihara falls deep into a state of contemplation, longing for a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 02
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Most people tend to avoid girls like me.
How is it that you manage to handle me so well, Commander?
Because you taught me, step by step.
Because you and I are similar.
I wonder how, or what,
I taught him so that he could handle me?
If he's been properly trained... then maybe he and I can enjoy a few things together.
Haha, I'm looking forward to it.
Hmm...
I don't think that's true.
Maybe he was only lying and trying to understand me better?
Mihara falls deep into a state of contemplation, longing for a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 03
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I don't mind if other people give me a wide berth,
but it upsets me a lot when they avoid Yuni.
Do you find being around Yuni uncomfortable, Commander?
No. Honestly, I haven't given it much thought.
Well, not necessarily, but...
Oh, what I must have felt when I heard that response...
I'm sure I felt incredibly touched.
His answer shows that he sees Yuni for who she is, without any preconceived bias.
The fact that he hesitated must mean he felt some discomfort.
Oh well.
If I meet him again, I'll tell him all about Yuni's charms.
Once he understands her, I'm sure he'll understand how charming she is.
Isn't that right, Yuni?
Mihara smiles as she watches Yuni tilt her head in confusion.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 04
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Tah-dah! Check out this new belt I got.
What do you think?
I think it'd be perfect for your wrist.
I think it's a perfect addition to your outfit.
Ha!
That was exactly what I wanted to hear.
He must have been thinking of cinching it around my wrist and cutting off the circulation.
Hehe, my heart's beating faster just thinking about!
Hmm... of course, belts are typically meant to be worn as clothing,
but I didn't intend to use them for that purpose.
Perhaps he gets a thrill out of teasing me.
Mihara falls into a state of contemplation with a smile on her face.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 05
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I bumped into someone earlier, and I enjoyed the feeling of our shoulders smacking into each other.
I thanked them, and they looked really flustered.
What should I have said instead?
You should have apologized.
There's nothing wrong with saying, "Thank you."
I realize that for most people, bumping into another person is an unpleasant experience, and so you apologize.
But for me, it was such a pleasant sensation.
Even now, thinking back on it, I'm not sure what else I could have said to them.
That's what I thought! I'm grateful to them, and so I'm thanking them. I shouldn't have to say anything else.
Hehe, I can't believe there's someone out there who understands me so well.
Mihara smiles as she imagines bumping shoulders with someone else.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 06
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Yuni and I decided to try something new today.
Would you like to join us, Commander?
I wouldn't want to interrupt.
Sounds a bit overwhelming, to be honest.
I wonder what my reaction was?
I imagine I must have been disappointed with being rejected.
But then again, having some alone time with Yuni is also precious in its own way,
so maybe I was grateful that he picked up on that and respected it.
Hmm, I guess we didn't get together as a trio.
I wonder what happened afterward.
Did we become a little closer?
Mihara falls deep into a state of contemplation, longing for a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 07
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I have to be honest, Commander, you're not usually the type that I go for.
I'm all about things that are stimulating, whereas you're so soft and gentle.
And yet I'm inexplicably drawn to you.
Maybe you're getting into softer things as well.
I actually happen to be a stimulating person.
Hmm, that may be true,
but I don't think my tastes have changed all that much.
Maybe he was more stimulating than I remember?
Haha, I think he was correct.
He must have been more stimulating than I thought.
And since I do love things which stimulate me,
he was perfect for me.
Mihara smiles as she recalls a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 08
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Hmm...
I feel oddly tired today.
How about taking a rest?
How about some stimulation?
That couldn't have been too long after we met each other.
Otherwise, he would have known my fatigue came from a lack of stimulation.
The more I rest, the stronger the stimulation I require.
The fact that he responded like that must mean we must've had some very stimulating conversations afterward, huh?
I'm sure my fatigue completely vanished.
It's just a guess, but I probably kept coming up with excuses to see him more often. Hehe.
Of course, the fact that my life is on the line is plenty stimulating, so I don't have time to rest now.
Mihara lets out a bitter smile as her fingers gently brush the necklace around her neck.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 09
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Commander.
What if I felt pain like other people do? What would happen?
Then you wouldn't be you.
Wouldn't that be a good thing? You could live normally.
He's right... The pleasure I find in pain has become my very existence.
So naturally, my end will be pain as well.
Haha, what a simulating life!
Normal, huh?
Doesn't seem like a word that fits me all that well.
Besides, once I've tasted pleasure, I'm not one to let it go, hehe.
Mihara lightly pinches her thigh and blushes.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 10
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Hmm... The pain you and Yuni inflict feels strangely different somehow.
Could you try hitting my hand, Commander?
Hit hard.
Hit with controlled strength.
While I don't remember all the details,
I do have a vague memory of how that hit felt.
Yuni and I are careful to hold back so we don't end up breaking each other. But I guess he couldn't manage that... being a beginner and all.
However, that kind of clumsy roughness can sometimes bring a novel kind of thrill.
While I don't remember all the details,
I do vaguely remember thinking he was being too gentle.
I usually prefer being treated more roughly, but... I wonder if I enjoyed his kindness as well?
Mihara smiles as she recalls a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 11
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I just got some fun new items from the club.
Would you like to take a look later?
What did you get? Some snacks or drinks?
I assume I need to head to the dungeon, yes?
Right. Unless you're more specific, most people would assume you were talking about food or something similar.
From what I can remember, that club had another section inside.
It was super dark in there, and there were all sorts of goodies inside.
If he'd noticed that, it would have been much more fun, hehe.
He picked up on it right away.
He must have been a regular at the club.
I wonder how many conversations we shared there?
I want to remember everything.
Mihara smiles as she recalls a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 12
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
What do you think will happen to us in the distant future?
Will I still be with you and Yuni?
Of course. We'll always be together.
I don't know... Nothing is certain.
I seem to recall being grateful for those words then.
We may not be together now,
but let's make sure that we meet again.
I don't remember how I reacted, but he was right.
After all, no one knew this is how we would end up.
Reality is the harshest mistress of them all, hehe.
But that's all right. I'm sure I'll see him again... someday.
Mihara thinks longingly of a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 13
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I'm curious.
What is the worst pain you've ever felt, Commander?
When I got pierced through the stomach.
The pain of losing someone precious.
The human body isn't built to endure such pain.
It must have been excruciating for him.
I hope that pain doesn't haunt him.
He's right, emotional suffering is frightening.
I have yet to lose someone precious to me, at least permanently.
I can only imagine how much pain he carries with him.
Mihara thinks longingly of a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 14
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
A collar?
Someone from a session before me must have left it.
Who does it belong to?
Yuni.
Biscuit.
You must have known that I was next and left it on purpose,
isn't that right, Yuni?
Yuni tilts her head while making a cooing sound.
Haha, thanks. I'm sure I had a fun time thanks to you.
Hmm, I seem to have a vague memory of her.
She was a very cute Nikke.
Anyway, I imagine I must have been a little disappointed.
If it had belonged to Yuni, I wouldn't have felt strange about using it myself, hehe.
Mihara smiles as she recalls a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 15
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Since we communicate with our bodies instead of words,
do you still think we could converse if we weren't able to speak one day?
Of course.
It might be a little difficult.
He's right. Spoken words are just a small part of conversation.
I'm sure he'll be able to
have a perfectly pleasant conversation with Yuni when he meets her.
Generally speaking, that's true.
Being unable to speak would render communication rather difficult.
But even if it's difficult, you can still have a conversation as long as you understand one another.
And if it's him, I'm sure he'll make an effort for Yuni.
Mihara smiles gently as she looks at Yuni.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 16
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
A new store just opened.
I got a quick glimpse of their merchandise, and it made me feel positively puritan.
I actually went there and bought a gift for you.
I just heard about it.
He was a smooth operator, that's for sure.
He must have been quite popular with the ladies.
Oh my goodness, I got jealous for a second!
Hmmm...
I don't remember anything after that.
We must have gone to that store together.
I hope it was a fun day.
Mihara falls deep into a state of contemplation, longing for a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 17
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
As time goes on, I find myself searching for increasingly intense forms of stimulation.
What happens if there comes a day when nothing satisfies me anymore?
You have me.
You have Syuen.
I don't know where he gets his confidence from,
but what a cool answer!
I'm getting excited just thinking about it.
Syuen?
Haha, it's true that she can give me stimulation that I don't feel on a regular basis.
I suppose there's truth to that answer.
Mihara falls deep into a state of contemplation, longing for a certain someone.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 18
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Whew... sorry for being late...
Gasp... Gasp...
How hard did you run?
You must have been having quite a fun time before this.
Haha, my breathing wouldn't have been that affected by running.
I wonder if he was actually that oblivious, or if he was trying to give me an out?
Hehe, he knew me so well.
Although I don't remember exactly,
I'm pretty sure I had a fun time with Yuni before the counseling session and lost track of time.
Hehe, what happy memories.
Mihara smiles brightly as she looks at Yuni.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 19
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
Commander, when do you feel most alive?
For me, it's when I feel pain.
When I feel emotions like sorrow or joy.
I always feel alive.
Since I feel both sorrow and joy through pain,
I suppose that, in a way, it's the same for me.
I feel a sense of camaraderie with him. I like it, hehe.
Hmm...
He feels alive without having to do anything.
He must have been a healthy person, both in body and mind. Haha.
On this day, Mihara feels alive too.
Mihara: Bonding Chain's Memories: 20
From the haze of her memory, Mihara recalls a counseling session with someone she misses dearly.
I had a strange dream.
Yuni changed into someone else,
and we never got to see you again.
It's only a dream. It doesn't mean anything.
I hope it's not a premonition.
I don't remember all the details of the dream,
but thanks to him brushing it off so matter-of-factly, I didn't pay it much mind, either.
If only it had been a meaningless dream instead of a premonition after all...
I don't remember all the details of the dream,
but I was right about Yuni changing.
However, it's not like I'm never going to see him again.
I'm sure we'll see each other again.
Mihara quietly closes her eyes as she dreams of the future.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 01
Have you ever heard that urban legend about this old game?
A mysterious character would appear in-game, but
not even the devs knew who, or what, it was. How freaky is that?!
Could it have been an actual haunted game with a ghost inside it?
What do you think, Mr. Commander?
Probably just a bug.
... What if it really was a ghost?
You think so?
In a way... that's even scarier.
A mysterious bug is way more terrifying than a ghost.
That'd actually be kinda fun, don't you think?
The only thing is, how do you exorcise a game that's possessed by a ghost?
Maybe you could craft some kind of ghost-hunting gadget?
If it were up to Mr. BOOM Guy, he'd take care of it no problem.
No ghost would stand a chance against Mr. BOOM Guy.
Elegg and I talk about the frightening unknown that resides in games.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 02
Blazing sun!
Brutal humidity!
Sweltering heat!
What's the best thing to do in this kind of weather?
Staying inside, cranking the AC, and getting your game on.
Swimming in an outdoor pool.
You know what's up, Mr. Commander!
Nothing beats gaming in an air-conditioned room.
That's the true essence of summer fun.
I guess that's cool, if you're into that kinda thing,
but me personally?
I think the best way to spend the summer is gaming indoors, with the AC running.
Wanna join me?
Elegg and I chat about the best ways to enjoy summer.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 03
This mission's location is really something.
You'd never get a seaside view like this in the Ark.
It's a shame Ms. Trony couldn't be here to see it.
Next time, let's bring Trony along.
Trony... might take some convincing.
Absolutely!
Getting her out of her room won't be easy,
but once she gets a look at this view, I'm sure she'll love it.
If we want this to happen, we've got to make it our top priority.
Hmm... Yeah, that sounds about right.
She's been venturing out a little more lately, but sea and swimsuits are a step too far at this point.
How do we make it happen...?
Oh!
I've got the perfect plan! Hehehe.
Elegg and I spend some time planning how to get Trony to come out with us.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 04
Mr. Commander.
What do you think of this swimsuit?
Isn't it amazing?
It's an ingenious design. Something that lives up to BOOMtastic standards.
Yeah, I'd love to give the gaming function a spin.
It's not just the design. It can actually play BOOM!
I put special care into crafting this transparent display panel,
which allows you to play BOOM on this swimsuit anytime, anywhere!
... Though when I tried it myself, it was kinda hard to see.
Guess I'll need to fix that part next time.
I knew you'd approve! You always know what makes something awesome.
You wanna give it a try?
Like I said before, to control it, you use the buttons here.
Uh… any chance you could change the buttons?
Huh?
Oh, haha!
I guess the buttons are a bit lumpy and awkward to use.
Hehe... looks like I'll need to improve the controls in the future.
Elegg and I talk about the functional design of her swimsuit.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 05
Wanna know something interesting?
There's an old movie that has a weapon just like the BOOMbastic Fantasm Gun.
They even made a video game adaptation. You know what I'm talking about?
I heard the game is just as fun as BOOM.
There's another video game with a similar weapon.
How can you speak such blasphemy?!
You're not mistaking it for another game, are you?
There's no way it can be as fun as BOOM.
Impossible, I say!
You mean that game where the mustachioed guy explores a haunted mansion?
Yeah, that one's a classic. It got better and better with each sequel, too.
Still not quite BOOM-level, though, hehe.
Elegg and I have a passionate debate about which games are the most fun.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 06
If we entertain the notion that ghosts really exist,
what kind of weapon would you need to fight one?
A chainsaw.
A BFG.
Chainsaws are a great way to get things started,
but would they really work on a ghost?
I feel like physical attacks wouldn't work on them.
Unless they're electricity-based, that is. Then it might do something.
Yeah, the BOOMbastic Fantasm Gun might actually have an effect!
Ghosts are probably more vulnerable to elemental attacks than physical ones,
especially when it comes to electricity.
That's because strong bursts of electricity create lots of light!
Elegg and I brainstorm weapons that could take down ghosts.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 07
This EMF reader is normally used to detect electromagnetic fields,
but some people also apparently use it to track ghosts.
Do you think there's anything to that?
I don't think there's much evidence to back that up.
Seems plausible to me.
That's what I think too.
EMF readers only react to electric waves.
If there aren't any electronic devices nearby, it won't make a peep...
*Beep beep*
Huh? Why's it going off all of a sudden?
Did you bring any electronics with you, Mr. Commander?
No. I came empty-handed.
Then why is it...
What makes you think that?
If ghosts really did exist,
I'd bet they would be plasma based.
Hmm, and if that were true, an EMF reader would be able to detect them.
If ghosts are made of plasma...
Does that mean we could use them as a power source to play BOOM?
Let's go find some ghosts right now!
Elegg and I brainstorm ideas to detect ghosts.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 08
Ugh... so hot...
I feel like a sponge that's been wrung dry.
Do you have anything to drink?
Hand over some extra fizzy sparkling water.
Hand over an energy drink with electrolytes.
Thanks a million!
*Gulp*
Whoa!
My tongue feels tingly, like I got an electric shock.
Anis drinks this stuff like there's no tomorrow.
Anis really knows her drinks!
Next time I see her, I'll ask for more recommendations.
Thanks a bunch.
*Gulp*
Phew... feels like my entire body's being rehydrated.
Nothing beats a burst of electrolytes when you've been sweating a lot.
Do you have something else? Feels like something's missing...
Elegg and I spend some time together sipping drinks.
Advising Elegg: Boom and Shock: 09
I think certain games are best suited for different seasons.
So, what kind of game is perfect for summer?
BOOM, obviously.
How about horror games?
No no no. You don't get it, Mr. Commander.
BOOM's fun no matter the weather! Hot or cold, rain or shine.
It's always a blast to play!
I'm talking about games that are just more exciting when you play them during a specific time of year.
Horror games do go well with summer.
